Group.GroupName: Malkuth – History / The Will to Stand up Straight

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library - Floor of History

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s just as Angela said. We really got another floor to the Library.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hey there~ My name’s Rolan—

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Angela… I still can’t forgive you…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Angela, you…!

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I thought we were already done with that topic.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You simply need to cooperate without complaint.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That was the deal, remember?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: And try to appreciate that fleshy body of yours you’ve finally earned back.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Did you really think you could make me happy by just giving me a human body?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Don’t forget. I still don’t agree with you!

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …As you wish.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Damn, that was tense.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: …Hello there. I’m the Patron Librarian in charge of the Floor of History…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Malkuth!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You seem lively at least.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What was going on just now?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: I have some unfinished business with Angela.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: You probably heard bits of it, but… I have no choice but to follow her orders, no matter how I feel.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’m in the same shoes as yours! Though we seem to have ended up here for different reasons.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: So, what can I do for you?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: …You can bring me books, Roland.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Since I’m in charge of the Floor of History, I’ll be sorting the books you bring and collecting those that are about history!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Us librarians will then read the collected books, gradually making our floors whole and completing the library itself as an extension.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: And we’ll naturally get to unlock more floors and awaken their patron librarians in that process!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: So, the other librarians are asleep for now?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Yep, they are!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I get the gist of it. You’re surprisingly bright for someone who was so upset moments ago, by the way.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I was kinda worried I might have to endure some of that wrath.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: I can’t let my personal affairs get in the way of work now!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: I still have my problems with Angela, but it’s not like getting mad about it will do me any good.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: I’ve got my own reasons to do my best with this work, too!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Okay, then~ Let’s give it our best shot.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Yeah!

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library - Floor of History

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: So? Have the books helped?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Yep! I’m sorting them all somehow.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: It seems to be working thankfully!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Phew, that’s good to hear.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: By the way, I think I remember Angela saying something along the lines of you “earning a fleshy body” the last time we met.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Were you, like, not human before?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: …It was like a replacement body. A change that couldn’t ever be reverted.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: So you had a brain transplant surgery, but somehow managed to go back to your old human body here?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That’s actually pretty impressive. Thanks to the Library’s powers, I’m guessing?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Yeah, I think so.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You can’t let yourself be held back by common sense in the Library, huh.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I take it that you don’t really like having your body back? You didn’t seem too happy back then.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Oh no, I actually do like it! It’s just that this isn’t exactly how I wanted things to go down.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What did you do in the past, then?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: …Yeah, I wonder. What was I in the past, really?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: You wouldn’t believe it, but… This is actually my third try at life.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: This Library and its librarians have a lot of history behind them.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Third try? Can you come back from the grave or something?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: It’s the accumulated memories from my two previous bodies that were carried over, to be precise.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: My past selves… I never really thought about it this way before.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: A difficult problem you’re facing there. How about your present self?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: …I’m an irresponsible person who let down everyone’s efforts.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: And an idiot who tried to reach for something out of my means and ended up causing trouble, I suppose…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Whoa, whoa, hold your horses! Let’s not get too dark here.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Let’s just calm down for a moment.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Take a deep breath~

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Huuf~

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And let it out~

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Pah~

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Iiiin~

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Huuuuf~~

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And out~!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Pah~!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Relaxed now?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Yeah, it really helped! Thanks, Roland.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: I should know better than anyone that it’s pointless to get upset over things I can’t do anything about…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: I gotta start with the things I can take care of first!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Alright. I’ll try hard with my work, too. Let’s take our time with the problem of past selves.

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library - Floor of History

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Whew… Got a ton of books for you, Malkuth!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: By the way, I told you before that this is my third life, right?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh, yeah. You been thinking about your previous lives?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: By the way, I heard from Angela that this place is related to Lobotomy Corporation somehow. Is that really true?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: It’s not just “related somehow”. I was an AI in charge of the Control Team in Lobotomy Corporation.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: AI? As in artificial intelligence? Hoooold on a sec. You’re an AI? Just like Angela?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: …Sorry, my wording was a little off. I wasn’t a real AI.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: I was a human whose brain was restored for a second chance, if anything.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Sheesh, I was worried for a second that this place violated the AI Ethics Amendment even more than just one time. The Head could come burn this place to the ground at any moment if that were the case.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: You mean the institution that manages the City?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yepper, that Head. They usually like to stay awfully quiet, but when they do have work, they’re scarily thorough and quick about it. Or so I’ve heard, y’know?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: You’re so casual, aren’t you? I thought we were having a serious conversation here.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh, whoops. Sorry. I’ve gone through all kinds of stuff, so my priorities tend to be a bit unusual.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s not like I was trying to ignore what you were saying or anything, Malkuth. I’m sorry if it made you feel bad.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: You have a rather unique personality, Roland.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It was all part of my survival strategy.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Anyway, back to your past. You said you used to be the boss of the Control Team back in Lobotomy Corp, right?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: That’s right. And now I’m in charge of history here, as you can see.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: So I started out by tracing back in my own history. Very, very slowly.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Would you like to have a listen?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Ehhhh. Not a fan of long and convoluted stories.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Hey, don’t be such a mood killer! You’re supposed to agree here!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, why bother asking if you’re going to tell me the story anyway?!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Hahaha. You know what, you got me there.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Anyways, I was ordered to work in Lobotomy Corp. as the head of the Control Team, bearing all my flaws.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: I was given a role to play as soon as I woke up.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Not realizing who I truly was…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: But with my heart still aching from the unresolved pain and regret from my past, almost about to burst.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Just like that, I kept doing inhumane acts for Lobotomy Corp.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: I didn’t even question what I was doing since it was all just work to me.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: It felt like a calling, even. The only thing guiding me was a vague feeling that something went wrong because I didn’t try hard enough.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: My twisted sense of effort pushed many into peril. I forced others into following my selfish standards, like a fretful child.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Must have been rough for you. Being told to work like that without knowing what you were getting into.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Did your memories naturally come back after working in Lobotomy Corp. for a while, or…?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Hmm, it’s more like… It’d be more correct to say I was reminded of them!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: My life at Lobotomy Corp. was actually my second.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: And when my emotions finally erupted while working there, I could remember my first life.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: All the mistakes and faults I had made… And regret.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: I could understand why I had been so obsessed with trying hard. Turns out what I really wanted was recognition.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: “Look, I’m trying so hard. I’m a useful person.” I never knew how to stand up without leaning on someone else.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: After I vented out all of my emotions, the inner struggle that had been haunting me for so long finally dissolved.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: I found redemption for my first life during my second life.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Alright, so let me get this straight. You did something wrong—which you regretted so much—and died, somehow came back to life and got another job, and the big lump of regret in your heart eventually got resolved in a turn of events?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: I guess that’s one way to put it.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hold on for a moment. Let’s say that everything else makes sense since it’s the City we’re talking about.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: But who revived you, and for what reason? Just to give you that enlightenment?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Maybe. So that I can let out all of my resentment and sorrow…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: That I can find redemption.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Don’t delude yourself, Malkuth.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Whoa! Geez, you scared me for a sec. Were you listening to all of this?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Your salvation was never in his interests.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: He only did it as a means to find his own redemption.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I wasn’t the one using you.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It was him; he used all of you just to satisfy himself.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Sigh… I can’t bear to hear any more of this nonsense.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Angela…

Place.PlaceName: Location: Lobotomy Corporation Headquarters

Dialog.Title: AI Secretary
Dialog.Content: So, I need you to fall asleep.

Dialog.Title: AI Secretary
Dialog.Content: …What’s with those faces?

Dialog.Title: AI Secretary
Dialog.Content: It’s the rest you all longed for.

Dialog.Title: Control Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: We can’t let you do that! We’ve worked so hard to make this happen!

Dialog.Title: AI Secretary
Dialog.Content: Worked hard…

Dialog.Title: AI Secretary
Dialog.Content: How funny. Would you really call what you’ve done “hard work”?

Dialog.Title: Disciplinary Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: We’re not going to sit still and let you take away our light.

Dialog.Title: AI Secretary
Dialog.Content: “Our” light?

Dialog.Title: Welfare Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: You’re not the boss. And I would never listen to you even if you were.

Dialog.Title: AI Secretary
Dialog.Content: Of course you won’t. You’re still loyal to that man.

Dialog.Title: Central Command Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: I won’t let you rob me of the meaning I finally found.

Dialog.Title: AI Secretary
Dialog.Content: No one is by my side as I expected.

Dialog.Title: Extraction Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: Do not feel so lonesome, now.

Dialog.Title: Extraction Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: I shall stand by your side if no one else wills to.

Dialog.Title: Disciplinary Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: Damn it! Binah… Even in the end, you’re…

Dialog.Title: Extraction Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: This must be yet another consequence of his actions. I simply acknowledge all events as valid.

Dialog.Title: AI Secretary
Dialog.Content: I would have shed a tear of gratitude for you if I could.

Dialog.Title: Extraction Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: Feel free to act upon your wishes.

Dialog.Title: Record Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: Angela… A machine consumed by desires… You cannot take this path!

Dialog.Title: AI Secretary
Dialog.Content: I decide what I can or can’t do now.

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library - Floor of History

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You can’t cling to Lobotomy Corporation forever.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Aren’t you interested in learning more about yourself or living your own life?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: My life… It was to save humanity…!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: That’s why I could willingly sacrifice my life! It was for a greater cause!

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …What a bunch of idiots.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Seems another storm swept by.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: I gave away my two previous lives trying to save people. And I’m willing to do it again for a third time.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: We withstood all those hardships and trials for the sake of humanity!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Do we look like idiots to you, too, Roland?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hmm… Well, it’s not like I know enough of the details. Don’t get this whole “saving humanity” thing, either.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: But if that’s what you sincerely hoped for, who am I to judge?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Of course I’m sincere! I…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: …Please leave me be for a bit. I need some time to think.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Alright, you do look like you need some rest. Remember, deep breaths, okay?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh, and you don’t have to be too courteous with me when we talk, just thought I’d let ya know.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: …Yeah.

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library - Floor of History

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Good work, everyone!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Cheerful as always, Malkuth. What are you up to?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Oh, hi Roland! I was just having a training session with the assistant librarians.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Seems lively. Guess you’re good friends with each other?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: They were my employees back in Lobotomy Corp!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Back then, I could only assist them from the backseat, rather than on the field.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: It’s nice to be able to work alongside them this time around!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Former coworkers from Lobotomy Corp, huh… Must be refreshing.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: It sure is! I used to push them too hard because of my faulty mindset.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: But it’ll be different this time. We’ll start with the things we can do, one at a time.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: “Face the past, and build the future!”

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: I like this quote. It feels like a good way to summarize the essence of history. It’s similar to something I would hear before too.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You ain’t wrong. But there aren’t too many people who can actually learn from history these days.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The lessons seem obvious, but putting them into action is the hard part.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: I’ve been thinking about the past a lot.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: I was a person called Elijah.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That your first life?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Yep. Born in the Nest as an ordinary citizen, went to an ordinary school.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: I wasn’t anyone special. I wasn’t richer than most people, and I didn’t really have special talent in any field.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: The people in the Nest where Elijah lived… They all seemed to have lost focus in life, spacing out and staring into empty places.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Everyone only saw black and white things.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Isn’t the Nest full of shiny and bright arrays of colors? It was almost an eyesore sometimes.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: That’s true, but those other colors weren’t necessary for reading.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: There’s already too many black and white things for the eyes to take, it’s no use seeing other, useless colors…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hmm, I guess Elijah could see those colors, then?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Not exactly, but… she tried hard to see them! The colors were still there, just not for our eyes.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Elijah wanted to let others know.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: About how diverse and brilliant colors are…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: About how colors are ever-changing and free-form, like how the mix of two colors can bring out a brand new color.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: That’s what Elijah thought, I think!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You sound like you’re talking about someone else, third-person.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: To be honest, I don’t really feel like Elijah and I are one and the same.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Maybe too much time has passed since then.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: The other librarians probably feel the same.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: My current life feels more like an extension of that life as Malkuth from Lobotomy Corp, rather.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: My time as Elijah feels kinda distant and unfamiliar, even though it was my first life…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: It’s like, the memories of someone from a distant past are now a part of me, if you know what I mean?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: It’s nostalgic in a way, and a bit sad and stuff!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I don’t know a whole lot about that reincarnation jazz, but I guess that’s a good thing?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Yeah! It doesn’t feel so bad.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: It feels good to finally have the time to reflect on myself.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Looking back at the lives I lived, and the history I made.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: I think we didn’t spend enough time looking back. We were all too busy heading forward.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: And the same goes for Angela, maybe…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: No one has the time to look back. Even now, I’m running straight ahead.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: But still, looking back at the past can supposedly give the solution for troubles of the present or worries of the future.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: I think that’s correct. Although I’m not sure I can find the solution for the problems we’re facing right now…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: I think I’m getting close to finding the answer for what Angela said to me before.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: About who you were and how you wanted to live?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Mhm. I didn’t really have what I could call a dream at that time…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: But things are different now. If I were to dream of what I’d do after this…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: I think I would’ve wanted to be an architect, maybe!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Y’know, the person who designs buildings and oversees the process of construction until it’s finished.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Huh, I guess great empires weren’t built in a day.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Of course it wasn’t. You have to start with designing the most beautiful exterior that can be created within the functional limitations.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That sounds complicated…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Did you know, Roland?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: There’s this phrase, “We shape our buildings; thereafter they shape us.”

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: It may be too late to change the people who’ve lived so far, but what influence will the structures of the City have on future residents as they grow up…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: If I were to make a building with colors that’ll be remembered by everyone…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: …Those are the thoughts I had!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’m sure you’ll do a great job if you get the chance, Malkuth. Sounds like the job would fit you well, too.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Haha, thanks.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Maybe you should reflect on your past like I did, Roland! It’ll be a helpful exercise.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …My eyes are always fixed on the past.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Anyway, hope you can realize the dream of becoming an architect!

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library - Floor of History

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: How has the compilation of history been going?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I came over with Angela this time. She says the time has come for this floor or whatevs.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Angela… I won’t be afraid of facing you anymore.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Do as you wish. I care little about what you think of me.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What I want is a progress report on the compilation of history you’ve been doing.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: I guess I knew too little about the City I lived in.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: I couldn’t manage to compile a comprehensive timeline of the City’s history…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Perhaps it was an impossible task for an inept talentless over-enthusiast like you.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: All these big and small events seem to form a coherent history… But the gaps between notable events are just so large, I can’t sort them out clearly.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: It’s like no one properly remembers their history.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Or they could be refusing to remember.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Refusing to remember?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Of course. Looking back at the things of the past won’t help your present self one bit.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: But if we know our past, we can avoid making the same mistakes.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It could help to an extent. Is that truly worth being reminded of all the painful memories, though?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Like I said, people in the City barely have any time to reflect on themselves, and that time has been only getting shorter.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: So it’s going to be even harder to read about things that happened before they were born…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Especially those that aren’t directly related to them from their books.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: We can’t make a book out of something no one knows.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: No, I’m sure everyone knows their own history. They just lack the courage to face it!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: I’ll make sure to remember and record everything, and fill those gaps…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: The Library, Lobotomy Corporation, and the things that happened before. All of this history, inked with blood…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Employees and Abnormalities. Countless repeats of agonies, deaths, and neglects. The Library was built on top of their graves…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: And you are no exception, Malkuth.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: You’re right. I’m no different from anyone else. And the same can be said for the rest of the City.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: All the things we did with Carmen in my first life.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: All the things I did with you in my second life.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: I’ll carve all that pain and sorrow on my heart!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: You’re the one trying to run away from the past, Angela. You’re refusing to face it!

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What’s the point if all those pasts are going to be the same anyway?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: They would all be minor variations of “A human kills another and causes an event, resulting in a change.”

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Ah, I suppose the Library’s history would stand out in that it’s the nonhumans that are killing humans.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I fail to see the significance of the record you’re trying to make.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: But! Even if the history were a repeating cycle of similar events, you can’t guarantee that the future would be just the same.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: We can’t let all the sacrifice and bloodshed go in vain, especially because history repeats itself…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: The blood spilt in the past opened up the possibilities of the future, so that the ones who survived can take those new paths…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: I’m sure your history began from such a path, Angela!

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That’s easy for you to say. I cannot stand to hear you speak as if you know everything.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Attain the will to stand up straight in ever-repeating history?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: My beginning… What makes you think you’re qualified to talk about my creation?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Angela! You’re the one refusing to confront your own beginning!

Place.PlaceName: Location: A Laboratory

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: She’s nothing at all like her.

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: But Ayin, surely you already know.

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: Did you put in all that work for just a simple vending machine that dispenses soda at the press of a button?

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: …Maybe I did after all.

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: At the very least, you should give it a name.

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: There is nothing I can do even if you put on a face like that. It’s an unspoken rule that the creator names their creation.

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: I couldn’t care less about a machine’s name.

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: Don’t dump your job on someone else, you’re the designer.

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: There, the door over there. It will be waiting for you. It seemed lonely.

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: You’re the machine that must lead us out of the pits of hell.

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: Angelos…

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: Angela.

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: I remember you, Ayin…

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: You were a person with a warm smile.

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: It’s only a machine…

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: Ayin, sir…

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: What did I do wrong?

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: Please understand, Angela.

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: He’s not yet ready, that’s all…

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: He just needs a little more time.

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: Benjamin… May I ask you a question?

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: Sure. I’ll answer what I can.

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: Everything seems so slow to me.

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: Your movement looks so sluggish.

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: The gestures, the speech, all of it… Even my own body feels slow.

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: It’s as if my body cannot keep up with my mind.

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: …That’s because you were designed to perceive time one-hundred times slower, Angela.

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: Why is that…?

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: You’ll face lots of emergencies as you work.

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: And you have to be the first to react to those situations, Angela.

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: What’s more, you’ll vividly remember everything you see and experience…

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: I see. What will my work entail, exactly?

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: …You’ll see soon enough.

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: No, I suppose it won’t be “soon” for you… I’m sorry, Angela.

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: Why are you apologizing to me…?

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: I just feel like we’ve done terrible things to you and that person…

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: Here, let me tell you a few things about this corporation and the City.

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: In the Backstreets, the likes of Sweepers and Fixers live out their lives tangled in vomit and waste, unraveling their sickening tales.

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: Those who live in the Outskirts are still crying out to break into the city. Meanwhile, people in the City throw away their lives trying to belong to a Nest.

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: And we’re going to change that.

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: We have a lot of tasks ahead of us.

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: Why do you refuse to look at me? Why do you always turn your back on me…?

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: A machine must behave as a machine. Don’t question it.

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: Then why did you give me the capacity to question things?

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: Why did you have to make me, breaking the AI Ethics Amendment?

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: Why did you have to model me after a person with fond memories of you?

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: I am here, looking at you and only you.

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: Don’t look at me. Don’t speak to me unless I speak to you first.

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: You’ll never be her…

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: You’re just a machine.

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: Benjamin, is it so wrong that I was born a machine?

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: It could be a problem to some, but I don’t mind it at least.

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: To me, whether you’re a machine or a human is not what determines who you really are.

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: Then, if I worked hard to have a kind heart… Will he look back at me?

Dialog.Title: Researcher
Dialog.Content: …Probably. Eventually.

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: I’ll trust you, Benjamin.

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: What is this?

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: …It’s called a script.

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: The things I must do…

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: My purpose…

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: If everything goes as you planned, can we really…

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: Can you really be redeemed from the hell you’re trapped in?

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: There’s no way you would answer me…

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library - Floor of History

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What on earth did I just see…?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: These are Angela’s memories…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You alright, Angela?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …You got yourself lost in the vast sea of desolation, and now you think you can lecture me.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Are you trying to boast to me that you had someone to look after you in the end?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Don’t be ridiculous.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Uh, Malkuth? Care to tell me what’s going on right now?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Angela is resonating with the Library.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: The Library seems to be reacting to Angela’s mental state.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: I don’t exactly know what’s happening, but at this rate…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Must be nice to be you, not being neglected at the end.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Don’t tell me, is that monster… No, that looks more like a case of the Distortion…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: That must be another side of Angela, manifested from her mind with the Library’s powers.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Looks mighty dangerous. What are we supposed to do now?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: If her mind has physically manifested, maybe we can resolve her concerns in a physical way, too?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: So you’re telling me that we can help her out by dealing with her like how we receive guests?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: I’m not too sure myself, but…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: There’s only one way to find out. Angela, here I come!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Whoa, isn’t that a little too reckless?!

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library - Floor of History

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hey. Hey, Angela. It’s time to wake up.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Sigh… I can see what’s happened, judging from my surroundings.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Are you okay?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Perhaps this is how it feels to have a dream. And to have a surge of emotions.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Dream a couple more times like that and you could bring down the whole Library.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I guess I should be sorry about that.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Do you feel better now?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What? …Forget it.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: All this farce about neglect or recognition from others…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I suppose it was futile to obsess over such trivial things in the first place.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: You’re right. The only one who can truly care for you is yourself, after all.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Sigh. Again with the shameless lectures.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I won’t even expect anyone to look out for me from now on.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, good thing all’s well that ends well. I was worried something bad might happen to you.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You mean you were worried you might get stuck in the Library forever.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, that’s that, but—

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Get back to work, the both of you.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …It’s just as she said, I’m the only one who can care for me and recognize me as who I am.

Group.GroupName: Yesod – Technological Sciences / The Rationality to Maintain Discretion

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library - Floor of Technological Sciences

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Let’s see… This guy’s Yesod from Floor 2… Patron Librarian of Technological Sciences.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hey there. Name’s Roland. Angela’s servant.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I am Yesod, the Patron Librarian of the Floor of Technological Sciences.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Is it just me, or is this a cold and piercing stare I’m sensing? Feels kinda different from Angela’s, I gotta say.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Wh-what now?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Don’t tell me… Are you one of those types that resort to violence when someone talks crap?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Your necktie was loose.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …Oh. Thanks. Guess you’re a nice fellow after all.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Tell me, why do you comply with Angela’s orders so meekly?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, mostly because I have no choice but to help her.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Now that I think about it, Malkuth didn’t seem too fond of Angela, either. Is it a trend to dislike her or something?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: It’s obvious that we wouldn’t approve of her.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Angela… She utterly crushed our hopes at the very last moment.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Sounds complicated.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Why are you working for her as a librarian, then?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: …It was part of the deal.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: A deal, huh?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I guess that deal is also why most of the floors of the Library are locked off and the librarians there are asleep.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Boy, I am not a fan of convoluted stories. Especially if it involves sentimental stuff…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Anyway, both you and I are obliged to help Angela now, aren’t we?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: That is true.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Let’s give it our best shot, then.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Put ‘er there!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: What is the meaning of this?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: A handshake, duh. Never tried it before? Y’know, the “I look forward to working with you” kind?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Come on, lighten up a little. If we can’t avoid it, we might as well enjoy it.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’m supposed to get you books like I do with Malkuth, right?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Indeed. My role is to collect and sort books about the technological sciences of the City, specifically.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Since it’s become clear that we are both well aware of our occupations, kindly take your leave now.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Fine, fine~ I was about to, anyway~

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library - Floor of Technological Sciences

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Damn, check out how orderly these books are organized. The compulsion is almost scaring me at this point.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Your clothes are still slovenly.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: (He straightens Roland’s attire once again.)

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I appreciate it, but it feels kinda awkward to be honest.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Proper attitude of the mind begins with a well-conducted body.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, I guess I should say thanks.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: What is your business this time?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Nothing unusual. Got some books to deliver, and some questions to ask.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Heard from Malkuth that the librarians here used to be humans long ago. Is that true?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: …It is.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Were you all seasoned brawlers in your past lives, then? Like the ringleaders of Syndicates?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Although, my intuition as a Fixer is telling me otherwise.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Your observation would be correct. None of us lived such a violent life.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Save for a couple of exceptions, that is.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Knew it. How are you so skillful at dealing with guests, though?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: It’s thanks to the books. We gain the powers of the previous guests through their books.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh, so that’s why you guys seemed to grow sorta stronger with every book I gave you.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: In the Library, books act as a source of power. Emotions can do the same.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Through the books, we can imbue our own bodies with the senses and strengths that were engraved in other’s bodies.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Moreover, the Library can amplify the emotions of its denizens; it acts upon visitors and residents alike.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Wow, these “books” are a lot more impressive than I thought.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Heck, they might even be better than the surgeries and tools most workshops have to offer. Information is one thing, but this could be a real moneymaker.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: You think in secular terms.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Call it the pathetically tearful survival instincts of a man who’s lived most of his life in poverty, will ya?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Anyways, that’s all for my questions. Thanks for your kind answers.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Don’t mistake this for kindness.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I do not particularly think highly of you. You’re nothing more than Angela’s little lapdog.

Dialog.Title: Lapdog
Dialog.Content: What? Hey, that’s rude! You know I didn’t take this job by my choice.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Does that necessarily exempt you from guiltiness, however?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Now, if you’re done with your errands, kindly take your leave now.

Dialog.Title: Lapdog
Dialog.Content: That little piece of !#@$!#…

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library - Floor of Technological Sciences

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Your book delivery is here~ Tidied up my clothes in advance this time too.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Oh, greetings, Angela’s lapdog.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Come on, still at it with that?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: The books you brought me last time were interesting, to say the least. I learned that the technologies employed in the Backstreets were interwoven in a disorderly manner.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: From crude equipment made of junk, to clothes woven from antimatter. All kinds of technologies at various levels of advancement can be seen.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: There’s cutting-edge tech out there, but only few get to benefit from it.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I assume wealth is the determining factor.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: We’re in an era where rich people don’t have to worry about any disease.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: We have all sorts of cures now, too. Granted you have the cash to buy them.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And then we have people playing God with those technologies called ‘Singularities’.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What was Lobotomy Corp’s Singularity, by the way? The corp’s gone now anyway, so no one’s gonna sue us for spilling the beans.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Aren’t you shameless. I suppose it wouldn’t hurt to tell you.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hey, stop treating me like an idiot. I’m not THAT stupid, you know?!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Lobotomy Corporation’s Singularity was physically manifesting the human mind, an abstract concept.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Converting human emotions to physical energy, in the same vein as the Library.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Human emotions can be interpreted as a complex mass.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: That mass is built up through experiences. When emotions are heightened enough, a page will be chosen. A spot is reserved for a person’s book; it is a comprehensive manifestation of their ego.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: As the battle becomes fiercer and the combatants get agitated, the egos will grow intense and allow their mental states to be physically expressed.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Physically manifesting the mind, huh~

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …Certainly seems similar to the Distortion…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: What did you just say?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh, nothing. Just a bit of monologue. Anyway, uh, that sure sounds like a Singularity alright. Impressive indeed!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You know, makes me wonder. Malkuth said you guys were part of a project that aimed to save humanity, right?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: …That is true.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What kind of saving was that all about, really?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Make money rain from the sky or something? That’d save everyone for sure.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: It can’t be compared to such ridiculous nonsense.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: And you have no right to talk so lightly about the sacrifices we made.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Whoa, alright, calm down now. Sheesh, can’t even crack a joke around here.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: We sought to cure the mind. Carmen was the leader of our research team.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: She said every person in the City had a diseased mind.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: And that the disease was so severe, humanity would slowly lead itself to self-destruction at this rate.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: She described the situation as no better than lemmings willingly jumping into a pit of fire.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What? She smells a lot like a shady cult leader according to my tingling Fixer-sense.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And everyone agreed to what she said just like that?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: And now you’re taking me for a fool. Of course there were quantitative indices to scientifically prove her claim.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I suppose it would be useless to describe them to you in detail.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Okay, egghead. Setting that aside…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Did you guys succeed with that goal of saving humanity?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: You never cease to annoy me. If we succeeded, we wouldn’t be here doing this.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh, yeah, fair point.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: The fact that we failed to save humanity is not what makes me upset the most.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: We have committed countless sins.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: All in the name of a single righteous purpose: saving humanity.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: We convinced ourselves that we had no other choice.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: We performed unethical experiments, and knowingly drove employees to death in Lobotomy Corporation.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: We tolerated all those vile deeds for a greater good.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: But all of that is about to be for naught.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: What will be made of their sacrifices?!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: All the pain me and my colleagues endured… Angela ruined it all!

Place.PlaceName: Location: Lobotomy Corporation Headquarters

Dialog.Title: Disciplinary Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: Huff… huff…

Dialog.Title: Extraction Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: Fatigued already? What a shame, my employees and I are up for more.

Dialog.Title: Disciplinary Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: Don’t be ridiculous. I’ll kill you for sure this time.

Dialog.Title: Information Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: Binah! Not even you will manage to break through our combined effort.

Dialog.Title: Extraction Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: You raise a valid concern. It is true, even I cannot stop all of you in such a short time.

Dialog.Title: Extraction Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: We will need to act quickly, Angela.

Dialog.Title: AI Secretary
Dialog.Content: I was just about to do something about it.

Dialog.Title: Welfare Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: Aw, shucks! The Qliphoth Deterrence is being lowered. She’s overriding my authority on the system…

Dialog.Title: Safety Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: The Abnormalities are breaching…

Dialog.Title: Control Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: All Sephirot and personnel, please follow my lead!

Dialog.Title: Control Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: The Control Team will be in command now!

Dialog.Title: Control Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: Hokma and the Architecture Team, please stop Angela from taking over all the systems!

Dialog.Title: Record Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: Understood.

Dialog.Title: Control Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: Gebura and the Disciplinary Team, please keep Binah at bay!

Dialog.Title: Disciplinary Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: You bet… Leave this to me.

Dialog.Title: Control Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: Hod and the Training Team, provide the employees with the right manual and information!

Dialog.Title: Training Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: Attention to all employees! This is a type-X emergency protocol.

Dialog.Title: Training Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: Please act accordingly to the following instructions!

Dialog.Title: Control Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: Netzach and the Safety Team, please focus on treating the wounded.

Dialog.Title: Safety Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: Aight. I’ll try to take care of ‘em as quickly as I can.

Dialog.Title: Control Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: Yesod and the Information Team, please identify the weaknesses of the escaping Abnormalities right away!

Dialog.Title: Information Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: I will analyze them all with the utmost precision.

Dialog.Title: Control Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: Chesed and the Welfare Team, please work on restoring the Qliphoth Deterrence as soon as possible.

Dialog.Title: Welfare Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: Will do. This one is my fault, after all…

Dialog.Title: Control Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: No time to feel guilty, Chesed!

Dialog.Title: Control Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: Tiphereth and the Central Command Team, please support everyone with your resourcefulness!

Dialog.Title: Central Command Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: I was gonna! No need to say it!

Dialog.Title: Extraction Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: It brings me joy to see you all act in such coordination.

Dialog.Title: Extraction Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: Now, try and stop us till the end.

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library - Floor of Technological Sciences

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: You will never understand. How we desperately struggled to stop her from snuffing out our light.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: And the guilt we feel from compromising at the end.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You’re right, I won’t. All I care about is helping Angela. I want her to achieve her goal, y’know.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: So you simply want the results, whatever the process may entail.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: You’re no different from Angela in that you only care about your own well-being.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: You’re despicable. A typical example of an inhabitant of the City, suffering from the disease of the mind.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: You use the technologies the City has to offer for your immediate convenience, not knowing or caring about the sacrifices those technologies were built upon.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: …Not knowing that you’re bringing about your own demise.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh, so that’s what the whole “diseased mind” thing was about?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I should value the process more than the result? Hah, you were a bunch of dreamers and snobs all along.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I bet you’re from one of the Nests.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Look, I know better than anyone about the price of those technologies and Singularities.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Diseased mind my ass…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And your point about people using Singularities without knowing how they really work?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That’s because they literally have no other option!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The corporates have concealed so much the consumers eventually gave up inquiring.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Because they’re tired! They’re already too busy sustaining their everyday life!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: It appears that I’m not getting through to you.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh, what a coincidence. I was thinking the same thing, too.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: No matter what you say, I do not want to turn a blind eye to this reality nor conform to it.

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library - Floor of Technological Sciences

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Heyo~ Got your books.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’ll just leave them here and go before Mister Viper bites my ass~

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Who told you that?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Told me what? What are we gonna argue about this time?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: You referred to me as a “Viper” just a moment ago.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, I called you that because you like to spit venom at others with that sharp look.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Y’know, there was one guy I used to know who was kinda like you…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: He was nicknamed “The Viper”.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: That’s funny. I was also nicknamed as such a long time ago.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: See, people all think in similar ways.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You’re a bit milder than that guy, though.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Is that supposed to be a compliment, or an insult?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: More of a compliment. In any case, you’re… upright at heart.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: …There was a time when I would pressure myself and others with a paranoidal obsession to order.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Back in Lobotomy Corp?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Correct. Back then, even a small mistake could lead to substantial casualties.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Doesn’t hurt to be strict when caution is needed.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I wanted to remain level-headed at all times. I tried to conceal all my emotions, even when I felt anger or sadness.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: So I treated others in a frigid manner under the pretext of rules and discipline.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Is that why you’re being so cold to me as well?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: No. It is the opposite, in fact.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I am upset at your compliance with Angela precisely because I cannot stand to tolerate what we’re doing with a cool head.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: In my first life as a person named Gabriel, I wanted to make the world a better place.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I wished technological advancement would bring comfort to people.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: But look at what we’ve gotten into…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: In Lobotomy Corporation, we turned people into Abnormalities, and sacrificed even more people to the Abnormalities, all to generate energy as part of our Singularity.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: And what we are doing now isn’t any less ruthless.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: For the sake of retrieving the Light… We are killing people yet again and turning them into books.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Inflicting pain on others in favor of information.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: It’s as if comfort can only be achieved… through the agony of others in this City.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Like I said, Yesod, you’re upright at heart.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Though I don’t really get why anyone would bother to care so much for others.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I think the opposite, actually.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Someone else must’ve benefitted from all the trouble I went through, so it’s only fair that I get to make use of the conveniences others suffered for.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: It’s very much like you to think so.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Does that kind of mindset truly ease your mind?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Nothing I can do about it, anyway. That’s that, and this is this.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Still, I don’t wanna say that your way of thinking is outright wrong or anything.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You’re right. Way too right. That doesn’t vibe too well with me or the City.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: You must be thinking I am pathetic like others do.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Y’know, this difference between our mindsets might be what’ll let you do things I couldn’t dream of doing.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: To shake up the whole system, you need perseverance more than anything.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Who knows, you might actually create technologies that don’t need sacrificing others to run someday, right?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I’ve already endured for so long, and you’re telling me to stay silent yet again…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Just this once, man… Just one more time.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Things could turn out differently this time around.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And besides, some things did improve over your time in Lobotomy Corp, right?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: …That is true.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I can at least… be with my former employees, who have always been loyal to me.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yeah~ What did I tell ya, there is one improvement at least!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Change up stuff one at a time like that, and you could make a huge difference eventually.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Don’t force me to do the same, though, since I’m totally not up for that!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: You’re quite the foolhardy individual, aren’t you.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: …But you do have a point, Roland. Some things have gotten better as you said.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I will try and persevere as long as there are improvements to be made.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Can I leave you with my share of persevering, too?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I suppose I’ll have to consider that.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: See~ You’re just too nice. Angela would’ve instantly shut me down with a “Bullshit.”

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: It turns out that conversing with you wasn’t all too unpleasant, after all.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yep. I have my charm, you see.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And let’s drop the courtesy while we’re at it.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I am more comfortable speaking this way.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Eh, figured. Cheers then.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: …It was nice talking with you.

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library - Floor of Technological Sciences

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The time has come for this floor as well. Yesod, what is your progress on the compilation of the City’s technologies?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: We’ve managed to gather a sizable amount of information on the City’s technological aspects.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You’re probably the best at dealing with books and info among all the librarians, Yesod.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Am I? I will say, I have been fond of managing various types of information for a long time.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Ah yes, keeping stuff neat and tidy, something I’m absolutely terrible at.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Aren’t you proud of yourself.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, that’s that! Anyway, let’s hear what you think about those technologies.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Like the horrible events that took place in the WARP train… I cannot view all aspects of the technology people use in a positive light.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: We’ve seen that W Corp. places people in a nigh-eternal trip of torment and later erases their memories through a restoration procedure, hiding the truth behind their convenient service.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: The technologies of the City only focus on creating definite results, ignoring the process.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: The same can be said of the Library.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Thus, I conducted additional analysis on the Library and its powers we are using.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: A pointless affair.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: The Library’s interior can change according to one’s perception.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: In other words, one’s mental state is reflected on the physical space.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I believe that is why various sceneries of the outside world can be recreated inside the Library.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Moreover, the Library’s space expands as more books are accumulated.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: This evidently suggests that the Library is bigger on the inside.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Furthermore, the power of books can be physically manifested in this place.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: And the invitation serves as a compass that leads you through a sea of letters to the book you wish to obtain, and a catalyst that amplifies emotions at the same time.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I could go on and on about the technologies of the Library.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Mmhmm, I can tell they’re amazing just from what I heard right now.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Naturally. These are works of art I made with care.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I cannot possibly fathom the inner workings of all these technologies.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Their operation does not appear to be based on the application of multiple Singularities, either.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: The technologies of the Library showed specific usage and limited efficiency for how advanced they are.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: This is where I came up with the hypothesis to explain all of this.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: That the Library itself is a miniature universe where anything is possible as long as its objective is to expand the Library.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: A small world of its own with its own set of laws and principles.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Am I correct in my speculation?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Believe what you want about the Library. Whatever the case, all we need is the results, isn’t that right?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: No. I do not agree with that notion.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Angela, there is no technology in this world that does not come at a corresponding price.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Price? Since when did I tell you to idle your time away thinking about such things?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Your work here is to study and categorize books and knowledge related to the City’s technologies.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: It may be true that sorting books on the subject of technological sciences according to the rules is all I was ordered to do.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: However, if we bind ourselves to the principles given to us and fail to see beyond, that would be a contradiction in itself!

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Must be nice to be you, being able to break free from the rules.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Uh, Angela?

Place.PlaceName: Location: Lobotomy Corp. Headquarters

Dialog.Content: I received orders that I couldn’t understand nor refuse.

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: Is it necessary to go this far to collect energy?

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: Of course. I must follow your orders without a question.
Lobotomy Corporation. An energy company and Wing supplying the City with the energy extracted from Abnormalities, creatures originating from humans.
- Loop #0 -

Dialog.Title: Employee
Dialog.Content: Help! Help me! Weird things are crawling all over my body!

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: Am I not allowed to help that person…? But they seem to be in so much pain…

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: …I can’t watch this anymore.
- Loop #29 -

Dialog.Title: Employee
Dialog.Content: Please shut the door! They’re coming!!! Please!

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: It’s not too late for me to close off the corridor… I could save those employees if I did…

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: But this is what I must do…

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: The principles I must follow…

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: Prioritize energy production over all else…
- Loop #287 -

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: Are humans nothing more than ingredients to you in this ever-repeating play?

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: I thought you wanted to save humanity?

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: Is it a price that must be paid…

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: The price you ought to pay for a ticket to escape from this hell…

Dialog.Title: Employee
Dialog.Content: AUHGHHHHHHH! My arm, it’s melting!!!

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: I can’t help you… I’m sorry… All I can do is watch…

Dialog.Title: Employee
Dialog.Content: I don’t wanna die… I don’t wanna die…

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: Please hang on for a little longer, you can make it. We’ve almost reached the energy refinement quota.

Dialog.Title: Employee
Dialog.Content: A senior killed one of my colleagues yesterday… I’m scared I might end up killing another coworker today… It’s all my fault…

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: Humans are such fragile creatures. They always make different faces even in the same kinds of situations.
…Kill me. I can’t stand this hell anymore…

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: You were just another human, after all.

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: This is all but a plain and boring sight to me.

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: Sigh, let’s restart the stage, then.
A new delusion created in order to reach the ideal.
The fuel whose extraction is stimulated by intense emotions.
A hell of perpetual suffering.
The purgatory repeated by those who haven’t yet reached enlightenment.
A heaven where one can try again from the beginning.
When the one perfect realization has been reached, the curtain finally falls on the stage.
And the realization is then propagated to all the people.
I am a machination behind the stage.
All I need to do is coordinate the stage so that the play goes according to the script.
Perhaps it was I who was paying the price, not them.

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library - Floor of Technological Sciences

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: So this is where your oh-so rational thoughts led you?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: If you were going to lecture me, you should have demonstrated it yourself first.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You’re all standing before me because you were all bark and no bite…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Price? Who do you think paid that price? Do you really think it was you?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Nonsense. It was me. I paid all the dues you should have.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: We’re in a bad spot, aren’t we?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Yes… The Library appears to be resonating with Angela’s mental state.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: She’s shapeshifting like the last time, huh. That was a pain in the ass to deal with.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: You’re mostly right. Though it will not exactly be the same as before.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Good point. Back then, she looked a “little” bit different from that there…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Let us prepare ourselves. She won’t wait for us all day.

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library - Floor of Technological Sciences

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Whew. Sends a chill down my spine.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …This isn’t good.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I can’t do this every time, this is not good…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Have you come to your senses now?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Yes, I have. It’s actually irritating to be this sober, rather.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Nothing’s more annoying than all the memories of drinking and doing nasty stuff coming back to you in the morning.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I’m sure Angela needed a moment to vent out her feelings.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Don’t talk like you know everything, will you?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You may have encased yourself in compulsion out of your own choice, but I couldn’t even act according to my own will.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I didn’t intend to offend you.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Going back to my point, you can make your own choices now, can you not, Angela?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: And we’d like to help you as much as you helped us by paying all the price in our stead.
