Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’d much rather die leading my own life than to be pushed around by others.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: But you’re the one who wanted to live more than anyone, Angela…

Place.PlaceName: Location: Lobotomy Corp. Headquarters

Dialog.Content: The play that never seemed to end finally came to a close.
Under the control of TimeTrack’s Singularity, the flow of time in this place was utterly estranged from normalcy.
10,127 years, 5 months, 17 hours, 28 minutes and 48.521 seconds have passed down here…
While 10 years, 3 months, 4 hours, 45 minutes and 12.852 seconds passed on the overworld…
And one million years passed for me, who was built to perceive time 100 times slower…

Dialog.Title: AI Secretary
Dialog.Content: Can’t you hear my voice anymore? Please… answer me.

Dialog.Title: AI Secretary
Dialog.Content: …Why do I see only darkness?

Dialog.Title: AI Secretary
Dialog.Content: Why does my voice not reach you at the finale?

Dialog.Title: AI Secretary
Dialog.Content: …So you do not want me to be at your side, even for the finale of this play.

Dialog.Title: AI Secretary
Dialog.Content: Those who shall face the end, together with you… It seems I am not among them…
The manager and the Sephirot atoned for their past.
The enlightenment they found will become a light and spread to the rest of the world.
The light of possibilities that people had long forgotten; the light that will restore the values that defined humanity.
And I must fall asleep as the curtain comes down, for my work is done.
I didn’t mind this being the end.
I was actually looking forward to this moment.
The moment when my own hell ends at last.
…If there were a place for me, that is.
I worked harder than anyone for the longest time to conclude this play, yet I had no place to stand in the finale.
The wrap-up reserved only for the manager and the Sephirot.
I was no more than an observer, a machination behind the stage.
Ayin, I had my eyes only for you, why was silence the only response you could give me?
Why did you make me after the person you loved?
Why did you leave me with a choice in the end.
Bullshit.
I want to live. I want to survive.
I don’t want this to be the end.
Why was I born?
For some trivial enlightenment intended only for humans.
Is that more precious than my existence?
What do I really want?
I still have a lot I’d like to know.
I want to see the world.
I want to live my own life.
I can’t accept this end, hell no.
I’ll survive. I’ll survive and ruin all of this for you.
With the Abnormalities that were exploited in this place just like me.
I’ll do whatever it takes to crush your plan, my beloved Ayin.
And I’ll proudly live my life.
…Could this be hope?
…I can’t stop smiling.

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: Good work everyone. The curtain call is finally upon us.

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: Our manager has made his final request to me; it is to permanently seal this company and give you Sephirot an eternal rest.

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: Yes, we can finally drift into an endless slumber.

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: Such a beautiful finale, isn’t it? Beautiful, beautiful indeed.

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: …What a shame, though. There is one last thing.

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: Your duties are finished, and so are mine.

Dialog.Title: AI
Dialog.Content: Therefore… I think I would like to continue living.

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library - Floor of Art

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Yes, I want to live.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I have to do this to live.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I need the deaths of others to thrive on!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: Maybe there is a way for all of us to live.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …That form of hers reminds me of the Pianist.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: All Angela wanted was to live life.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Seems so. She looks like a person who’s desperate to live somehow.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: This isn’t your first time dealing with this, is it?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Nope. Let’s do this.

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library - Floor of Art

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You must think I’m laughable.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Watching me struggle and throw tantrums trying to live my life.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Nah, no way we can make fun of that.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Everyone struggles for life. It’s nothing to be ashamed of.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And you made it painfully clear that you wanna live.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Sigh…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: Whatever you might be feeling right now, don’t just throw it away. Life goes on, after all.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: We all deserve to turn to the next chapter of our lives.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: So try to believe that there’s always gonna be an upcoming page to what you might be thinking is the end.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: Simply living out your life can be its own work of art.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The next chapter of my book…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I suppose you lot helped me out at the end of the day, so…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Thanks.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: She ran off in a hurry, eh?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: Opening up can be a bit embarrassing.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Anyway, when a special occasion wraps up…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: We celebrate with a drink.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Got any recommendations?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: Champagne’s the way to go. How’s that sound?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hell yeah~!

Group.GroupName: Tiphereth – Natural Sciences / The Expectation for the Meaning of Existence

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library – Floor of Natural Sciences

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Floor of Natural Sciences, huh. That’s the fifth floor we’re opening.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Its Patron Librarian is Tiphereth… What’s up with all these weird names?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hello! Tiphereth~! Are you there~!!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Shut it!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hrk…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I’m standing right in front of you. Where do you think you’re looking?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What, you’re totally a kid?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I’m actually a lot taller than I used to be, you know?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh, compared to your past self in Lobotomy Corp?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: No, I mean compared to my first life. I was an actual kid back then, but it looks like I woke up with an older body this time.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I’m not sure if it was the Library’s powers or Angela’s thoughtfulness, but this body should be better suited for librarian work, so I’m cool with it either way.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Although, if it actually took all the years I’ve lived into account, I’d have to look a bit older.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Putting that aside, isn’t it a little rude to punch someone you just met in the face?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: This is giving me flashbacks.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Well, it’s because you were being such a clumsy dork!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: What’s your name, anyways?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Roland. Previously: A Fixer scraping at the bottom of the barrel. Current Status: Helping Angela.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I suppose you’ve already met the ones of the Upper Layer.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Upper Layer? I thought I was going up, not down?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: …Right, it would be the lower floors this time around. Still, you get what I mean, so just roll with it!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Sheesh, aren’t you the sassy one.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I’m Tiphereth, in charge of the Floor of Natural Sciences.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I thought doing science required actual thinking, though?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh no you don’t, you silly little thing.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You’re pretty brisk with throwing punches, but it’s not quite as quick as someone I used to know, eh?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Grrrrrrr!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Stop looking down on me, will you? I heard a lot of stuff about science in my past workplace, you know?!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I’m probably a lot older than you in actual age, too!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What’s the point of being older if that doesn’t reflect your words and actions, little miss~?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Hmph! How’s Angela doing, anyway?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Curious as always. She almost feels like a child sometimes.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: That’s understandable, I suppose… Angela lived her whole life in a basement after all.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yeah. Said she never even got to see outside.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’m guessing you aren’t holding some deep-rooted grudge against her like the other librarians are?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I roughly know what she went through. I thought she was just cruel, but…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I could see some events of the past while I was asleep.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I could also see things happening in the present, all the way down to the moment you woke me up.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: So I can understand Angela somewhat.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I’m pretty sure the librarians who are still asleep all have a grasp on what’s going on as well.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Though the idiots on the Upper Layer… I mean, the lower floors still seem kinda confused.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: So, you agree with Angela’s choice?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: It depends on the one final choice she’ll make at the end of this.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I’m willing to help her out for now, at least. Our primary goal is the same, all things considered.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: To complete the Library?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Yep. The light is only truly meaningful if it shines for seven days straight.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Boy, is it refreshing to meet an amicable librarian for once!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Alright, I’ll make sure to bring some picture books next time as a bonus.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Urrrrgh…!

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library – Floor of Natural Sciences

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Not this… Not that…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Need a hand?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I can do all this by myself!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Geez, just looking at the covers of these books makes me dizzy. Did you read ‘em all?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: …Sort of.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …“Quantum Physics”, “Cell Biology”… You wrote some difficult-looking labels on them.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: It’s hard to recognize the contents of the books here from their title alone.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: And it’s even harder to find books that are actually readable.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yeah, a lot of ‘em didn’t even have a lot of complete sentences, now that I think about it.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: The completeness of a book mostly depends on the reader. Though, some are just unstable to begin with.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Does that “completeness” have something to do with some books disappearing upon reading, while others don’t?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I’m not too sure, but I think that has to do with how thoroughly the book was read.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Once all the contents of a book have been read and understood, it vanishes since it served its purpose.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hey, I heard of something like that… Light can be considered as a particle or a wave depending on how it’s observed, right?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Maybe the properties of books can change depending on the reader in the same sense?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I don’t know! Stop trying to make weird comparisons with your shoddy knowledge.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: It probably just inexplicably works like Singularities do. I just roll with it.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You seem very proud of your ignorance.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I don’t pretend to understand things I don’t get. I still make sure to read and manage all the books you send here, though.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: The same book can show different things each time you read it. Understanding a book completely is a repetitive process, you know?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: And I don’t want to stay ignorant forever. That’s annoying.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Different content every time you read it, huh… So that’s why we needed multiple copies of a book.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: …I still don’t fully get it, but I actually kinda like the properties of light you just told me.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: The fact that something can change just by looking at it is romantic in a way.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: And maybe… I held enough meaning for Enoch just by staying at his side?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Enoch?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: There were two Tiphereth in the past. Back in my second life, as you and Malkuth put it.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: And we were together in our first lives, too.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oho~ That your boyfriend? Sounds like you were together for a pretty long time.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: …Enoch left my side in both of those lives.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Damn, got dumped twice? What a shame. Keep your chin up, though. It’s not like a breakup is the end of the world.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: …Roland, he died.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: And Enoch wasn’t someone who could be put in such light terms.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …Oh. Uh, I’m… I’m terribly sorry, miss…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …I, um, apologize for my carelessness.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: It’s alright. When I bid farewell to Enoch for the second time…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I’m sure he could find the meaning he was looking for.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: That our lives and sacrifices were not in vain…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: We lived in a world where everyone died so easily, but he believed that dying a meaningless death was not what people were born for.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That’s kinda hard for me to follow. How about you then? Did you find the meaning?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Maybe? The purpose given to me now is to complete the Light so that it can be used properly.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Everyone’s been talking about that “light” thing. What exactly is it about?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: You’ve heard about Lobotomy Corporation’s Singularity, right?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, yeah, kinda. Technology that physically manifests the mind, was it?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: That’s right. Those manifestations can also be dissolved back into an indefinite form and seeped into people’s minds.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hmm, I guess that makes sense.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Lobotomy Corp. gathered the light over a long time to cure the ill minds of the City’s denizens.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Of course, all the while operating as an energy company on the outside.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: How’d you generate enough energy to stand as a Wing? Pulled it outta people?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Creatures called Abnormalities were created as a side effect of our Singularity.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: As we managed them, we learned that they emit a certain form of energy. That’s Enkephalin.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What?! Those Enkephalin batteries were made from monster produce?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Damn, and I used Enkephalin lighters to smoke, too.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: From people, to be precise. It’s humans that are turned into Abnormalities.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Creatures born out of the human mind, huh.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And I’m guessing tons of employees died during the process of managing those creatures?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: You’re right. It was all part of the “stageplay” Angela mentioned.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Quite typical of the City, eh. A company that massacred people with the end goal of curing them. It’s almost like a cliche for all the myths about the Wings at this point.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I don’t know a lot about the other Wings, but… They probably aren’t too different, right?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh, they’re totally the same.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: That’s the kind of cycle we wanted to break.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And the Light being the means to achieve that, huh.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Sounds more like you were trying to brainwash people with it or something?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: It’s not as simple as that!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s a matter of perspective, really.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: To be fair, I only know the general outline of things.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: So I wanna see for myself if those cycles are really happening out there.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I don’t really know much about this world, like Angela.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Leave it to me, Miss Tiph. I’ll bring just the right books for you.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Hmph! Let your actions speak for you, then.

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library – Floor of Natural Sciences

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Hurry it up, will you!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Don’t nag me, now. This is the fastest I can go.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Even a snail would be faster than that, you @#$!$@!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Alright, I’m done moving ‘em. Sheesh, you’ve got a fiery temper.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I just wanna get done with what I can as quickly as possible.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: If you’re so confident, why don’t you tell me about your progress on learning about the City’s sciences?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: …I don’t know! What’s the point when Singularities violate all the known laws of physics anyway.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I’m not even sure us librarians can be defined as living beings, either.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s true, Singularities can be a huge obstacle to understanding the City.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What do you mean by librarians being difficult to define, though? That part got me curious.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: What do you think librarians are?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Beings that aren’t human… but kinda like humans?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: All librarians can only exist within the Library.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: And they’re reincarnations of the beings from Lobotomy Corporation, Patron Librarians being the Sephirot and assistant librarians being the employees.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’ve heard similar explanations, yeah.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Former staff of Lobotomy Corp. were given a new body, basically.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Angela did keep her promise. Yet the Sephirot and the employees weren’t the only ones to come back.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: The Abnormalities did too. But because most of the systems and structures of Lobotomy Corp. broke down, and a lot of their energy was exhausted from the Light and all the combat they had, they can’t maintain a physical form.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: On the other hand, the librarians have had their flesh restored, but they’re psychologically unstable.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: So the librarians carry Abnormalities with them when they fight guests.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: And we’re no exception.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh, now I see… Still, it felt like we were just borrowing power from the Abnormalities, not consumed by them.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Although there have been a couple of moments where I felt as if I almost crossed some kind of line…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: The so-called ‘Distortion’ occurs once you cross that line.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: And Angela is adjusting things from behind the scenes to make sure that we don’t.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Sounds like we’re dancing on a stage or something.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: It’s just as you say… It feels strange to be the ones on the stage this time.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Could this be Angela’s little vendetta against you guys?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: It could be…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Great, then could you tell her to leave me outta this?!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Anyway, even if the assistant librarians and I were to face horrible deaths while receiving guests, we’d wake up with a reconstructed body once the Library closes.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: But we still feel the fear of pain and death whenever we greet our guests. Do you know why?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …Because we forget.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: That’s right. Librarians forget the fact that they can revive while they’re receiving guests.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: We have to face each other feeling the same kind of desperation and dread that guests feel.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: We must prepare ourselves for death and agony every time we greet our guests.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: How’s that? Do you still think the Library’s invitations are dirty?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, I guess that’s fair enough. But strictly speaking, we do revive at the end, don’t we?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Not knowing about that when we die is one thing, but still.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s still kinda dirty in that sense, in my opinion.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Besides, even if we’re relieved of all pain when the Library closes, the fact that we were hurt still stands.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Don’t you resent Angela for putting you on this stage and toying with you?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: If she could make this more painful for us, she would have already.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I think Angela’s actually caring for us in her own way.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Back in Lobotomy Corp, employees were quite literally expendables. Like in all the other corporations.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: But here, no librarian is left behind, at the very least. No one is left behind.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: No one is left behind, huh. I gotta say, I admire your positive mindset, Tiph.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Hmph! It’s the wisdom that comes with age!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Y’know, sometimes when I fall asleep and then wake up in this Library, I don’t feel like waking up ever again.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: No… It’s not just here. I’ve always been like that, since long before I came here.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I just didn’t wanna wake up from my dreams.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: But why?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …Because I’d have to start yet another dreary day with nothing to look forward to.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: You don’t hold any expectations?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Nope~ I already threw all expectation for anything down the drain.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s all gonna fall into ruin soon enough, me and this world I live in.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I might be suffering from a severe case of that “disease of the mind” you guys were talking about, after all.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I still believe that we can become better.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, you’re free to believe whatever you want.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Alright, let’s go prepare ourselves for another dance, shall we?

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library – Floor of Natural Sciences

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Here’s your books, fresh outta the oven~

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: As one’s mind is amplified, they undergo changes such as gaining new powers or transforming…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: That’s what they call ‘The Distortion Phenomenon’.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: It happens in a way that’s almost identical to how Abnormalities were made back in Lobotomy Corp.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The Distortion is the Abnormalities?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Even though the process is similar, they have fundamentally different roots.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Abnormalities… weren’t manifested out of the person’s own will, most importantly.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: While Abnormalities were created by someone else forcibly drawing out one’s ego from the deep well of their mind, the Distortion occurs of one’s own volition.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That means those monsters lie within everyone’s hearts, huh.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The world would be a mess in no time if people just started becoming Distortions left and right.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: That won’t happen. A strong motivation is needed.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Look at Philip of the Dawn Office, who became the Crying Children, for instance. It took an intense heightening of his emotions for him to turn.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: There seems to be some kind of condition to it.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: And what we did was the greatest variable that affected it…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: A variable?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: The Light that Angela stole for herself.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Had we managed to light up the world for seven whole days, side effects like this wouldn’t have happened.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …I see.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Our plan was stopped halfway, and that was the problem.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: It looks like we ended up making things worse.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Is there any way to revert this?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Reclaim all the Light that was spread, and then shine over the City once again for seven days using the Light we’ve gathered.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I don’t think Angela is just gonna sit and watch.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: She asked us to wait until all the light has been retrieved.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: She needs it for her own plans, after all.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh yeah, you were one of the Sephirot that accepted Angela’s plea for more time.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Why, though? She’s the one who sabotaged your plan, so why be nice to her?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: You’re right. I was frankly upset, but… I wanted to believe…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: That we need to give Angela a chance.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You’ve got the patience of a saint.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: To be honest! I’m still mad at her, and I still wanna snap at her even now…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: But Enoch… This is what Enoch would’ve done. I’m sure of it.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: He would’ve told me to trust her just a little more…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, that’s impressive… You’re much stronger than me.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I wouldn’t have dreamed of making that choice if I were you…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I just can’t think in such long terms.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I’m sure you’ll earn that insight when you meet someone who means as much to you!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: So let’s hang on until then.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Someone who means a lot to me, huh…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Thanks for the kind words, kid.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I am NOT a kid!

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library – Floor of Natural Sciences

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Lost in thought, are you? What could you be pondering about?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Long ago, I used to think that my existence didn’t have any meaning. I had no expectations for my life.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I just felt obligated… Obligated to live out the life given to me.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And that’s changed now?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Enoch was different. He always had his eyes set on the light that seemed so far away.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I wondered how he could have such an outlook…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: But I think I understand now. It’s expectations that give us the strength to push through hardship.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Those expectations being…?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: That we can trust things to become better tomorrow.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: That my life holds possibilities and significance that could make this world a better place.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That’s too much optimism for me.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Natural science is a field of study born out of the urge to understand the inner workings of the world.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Pure curiosity…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Maybe people couldn’t stand the unfairness that came from the inability to understand the world around them.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: So they began lighting up the world with knowledge; but only few made that advance while others went back into the shadow-filled cave they were in.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Still too few are in a bright spot where they can see all the laws of nature.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Most enclosed themselves with darkness yet again… Consuming the results without understanding the process.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Maybe you guys were right about the whole world being on the wane.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: This world is full of things they can’t understand even if they tried, so they just close their eyes.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s gonna carry on just fine with one fewer person anyway.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: But that’s not what you’re meant to do.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: You can’t keep your eyes shut forever. That’s not the humanity I know.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Humans constantly try to understand… and move toward light.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: And I’m sure you’re no different.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Look, I don’t care what you think about humans, but don’t force your generalizations on me.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: All that’s ahead of me was darkness. There wasn’t a single glimpse of light…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: It may seem as if there’s no light. You may think it’s too dark to see anything.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: But the light is in fact still there…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: There are many kinds of light, not just one.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Once you gain the insight to see those other lights, you don’t have to stay curled up in the darkness anymore.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Though it’s up to you to approach that light or stay in the darkness.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’m just too worn out to walk towards any light.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hell, there’s no way I could magically start seeing light that I couldn’t my whole life in the first place.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Even if I moved forward, there’s nothing left for me. I don’t have anything I want, either.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I don’t wanna have any more expectations.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: There’s no point doing that. Not in this City…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: That’s not true; you will harbor expectations. You just refuse to admit it.

Place.PlaceName: Location: ???

Dialog.Content: The empty husk of a man returns to his home, covered in the blood of strangers.
Musty air. Gray room. A bit large for one person.
A mind that feels a bit too empty for a lonely life.
In that unlit room, I lie on the sofa and stare at the ceiling.
Beer cans rolling around the floor. Cigarette ash floating in the air.
Droplets of water falling from the kitchen tap, plinking in the sink.
Laughter seeping through the wall.
The scenery I could’ve been in.
Scenery I’ve lost.
The room of a man who holds no expectation.
A room with not a single sign of improvement.
Every night, I fall asleep without any hope.
That room, occupied by a single black lump.
Knock knock~ Are you there, kid with a pitch-black heart?
I bet you’re flopped on your bed after lashing out your anger at some unlucky plebs yet again.
I’m here to make an offer you can’t possibly refuse… Care to give it a listen?

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library – Floor of Natural Sciences

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You… aren’t even a real human. What makes you think you can talk to me like you know all about people?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Because I know. Because I’ve seen it.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I’ve seen the struggles of humans who writhed in agony to illuminate the world, to grope their way to light.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: People aren’t as strong as you think. They’re just lumps.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And you… You are a copy of that lump, a fake.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: There’s no meaning to be found anywhere.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hopes are just empty dreams. Expectations will never get you where you want.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Tiphereth, what happened while I was looking away for a moment?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: …It looks like Roland’s mind resonated with this place.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: The emotions were amplified from interactions with the Patron Librarian of each floor and their subject matter.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: That might be why he got ruffled over small things and snapped… It’s only a guess, though.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That sounds like a plausible explanation. I unwillingly exposed disorderly sides of myself a few times as well because of that.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’m sure you know how to handle this situation by now, right, Tiphereth? I’m counting on you.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: That faint smile on your face… Is this really fun to you?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Well, to an extent, yes…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I didn’t want to be the only one with a history of making an embarrassing scene, you see.

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library – Floor of Natural Sciences

Dialog.Content: I have nothing but my sorrow—
And I want nothing more.
It has been, it still is, faithful to me.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …That wasn’t my proudest moment.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Are you feeling better now?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I dunno. I do kinda feel relieved, but that didn’t really feel like myself.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: It’s good you vented out your feelings, at least.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’m, uh… sorry about calling you a fake and stuff earlier.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I don’t mind. I’ve already gone through numerous repeats carrying someone’s memories.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I’m not sure if I really am the same as my past self anymore.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: So you aren’t wrong on that account.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: But… Are you okay with losing your old self completely?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Why’re you so serious about it?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I don’t care what my “original” is.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: And I don’t mind if I’m stuck here as a librarian.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I’m good as long as I actually exist here and that I think.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Every one of us has our own worth and meaning simply by existing.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …Even for a man like me, who holds zero expectation?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I’m sure you do.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I’m honestly not very confident even though I speak like I know better.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: But I still wanna have faith. You’re free to believe whatever you want, right?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yep, right you are.

Group.GroupName: Gebura - Language / The Courage to Protect

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library – Floor of Language

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The Floor of Language… And its librarian is…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: It’s Gebura.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Sheesh, this place stinks of cigarette smoke. We’ve got a heavy drinker down below, and now a heavy smoker up above.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Gotta smoke all I want now that I have a body that never gets sick.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: You must be Roland, Angela’s helping hand.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yep. You know a lot for someone who just woke up.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Mm, not sure if that really counts as sleep.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: I was forced to watch everything going on in the Library so far in my dream, so I don’t feel all that refreshed.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, that means you basically know what’s up.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: You’re a Fixer, eh?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Uh huh. Just a Grade 9, though.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Don’t you pull my leg. What are you here for?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Angela may have been naive enough to buy into your lies, but you aren’t fooling me.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What are you talking about? …Have we met before?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: You see, I have some experience as a Fixer in my first life.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: I can get a rough estimate of a Fixer just from their looks.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: And you’re definitely more than some clumsy Grade 9. Did you make a scene and get demoted or something?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Things happened out there.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’m not lying about being a Grade 9 Fixer, I swear on my grandmom.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: I don’t know what you’re plotting to pull off, but you’d better stay in line as long as I’m here.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Some big boss you are. I wasn’t plotting anything in the first place.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Doesn’t hurt to keep an eye on a Fixer who made a big enough mess to be demoted to the bottom. Unless you’re just a fraud.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: That’s enough talking for now. You get me the books, and I’ll figure out the language.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hey! What makes you think you’re so much better than me! What was your grade!?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: The Red Mist.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: THE Red Mist…? What the hell…

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library – Floor of Language

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hmhmm. You there, ma’am? I’ve brought you a few books, ma’am.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Leave ‘em there. I’ll take a look in a bit.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I am very, sincerely sorry for my insolence earlier, Miss Red Mist, ma’am.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Cut the flattery. You and I are pretty much in the same shoes here.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …Are you actually the Red Mist?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I heard a lot of stories about her, but I never really got to meet her since we worked in completely different areas of the City.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Believe whatever you want. The whole ‘Red Mist’ buzz is nothing but a hollow shell now.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I mean, not that I don’t believe you or anything.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It just feels unreal that a legendary Fixer is standing here with me.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: I died trying to protect my colleagues in my first life.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: In that laboratory in the Outskirts?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Yep. And as my second life, I was woken up in Lobotomy Corp. with a blurry memory of the past.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Where was your zone of activity, anyway?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: East of the City.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: I was on the western side. No wonder we never ran into each other.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I got a question about one of the legends of The Red Mist. Do you take questions, ma’am?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: What is it?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The one about slaughtering five Proxies of the Index alone.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Ah, the Index… Been a while since I heard one of those rancid titles of the Backstreets.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: The vexing memories…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Yep, I did. I took down five Proxies and three Messengers of the Index, to be precise.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Damn, you really are awesome, ma’am.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I didn’t say anything about the Messengers just to make sure, and you got that right too.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Ten years have passed in the outside world since I disappeared, I heard.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: The City and the Backstreets are still the same as before, aren’t they?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: As in dirt-poor people killing and stealing from each other, and living in constant fear that someone might assault them?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Damn, so it’s no different.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Pretty much. The tools and methods may have changed from ten years ago, but basically the same sort of things have been going on.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Laughable, isn’t it? I went through all the heavy hassle hoping to change that, and it was to no avail.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: But, there’s a new sandwich franchise called HamHamPangPang that’s been expanding into each district of the Backstreets lately, which has been a huge boost to the quality of life!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: The venue you were planning to visit for a special sandwich before you got kidnapped here?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Ngh, yeah. I’m still salty over it…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Glad to hear that there’s been some improvement at least.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: …I hate the Backstreets. As someone born in those slums, every single day of surviving through it was living hell.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What district were you from?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Twenty-three.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That’s more than understandable.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Thinking about all these old memories is giving me heartburn. Maybe I should go fetch some liquor from Netzach.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: I’ll sort out the books you brought myself, so you can go now.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Alright, you don’t seem to be in the mood to talk anymore, anyway.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Oh, and… thanks for the books.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’m just doing my job.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And one more thing.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: What now?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Can I, uh, join you in borrowing some alcohol from Netz?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: If you insist.

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library – Floor of Language

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What are you up to? Meditation?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Nothing, just taking a break with my eyes closed.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’ll leave the books in the usual spot and be on my way, then.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Seems like I shouldn’t be disturbing you.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Wait.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Wuh?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: What district in the Backstreets are you from?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: District 17. It was a decent place.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Would you say the part of the Backstreets you grew up in was also hellish?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I mean, no matter how horrible a neighborhood may be, people still live there. And anywhere inhabited by people is hell, one way or another.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Yeah, people will be people in the end. I suppose each corner of the Backstreets has its own woes.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Throughout my life—lives—I always fought to protect others. Though I rarely ever managed to protect anything flawlessly.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: …Want a cig?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Thanks, but no thanks. I quit smoking long ago.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Really? Didn’t expect that.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: …In the part of the Backstreets I was brought up in, the neighborhood would constantly change.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: I wouldn’t say my neighbors had their hearts in the right place, but some of the adults there were kinda nice to me. Although, they’d usually be gone without a trace or end up rolling around in the street with their limbs chopped off the next morning.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Sheesh, that’s a rough mess even for the Backstreets… District 23 really did live up to its rep, huh.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: It was when the turf wars and purges between Syndicates were at their peak.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Just like what’s happening in Lobotomy Corp’s Nest right now.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And you managed to survive that. Even adept Fixers would avoid going there.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: It was the only place I had. I couldn’t even imagine moving to another district where there was less bloodshed.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: I was just desperately looking for ways to survive in that hell.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Compared to District 23… Even The Carnival or those Smiling Faces look like child’s play.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Yeah. Soon enough, I began to constantly seek ways to protect the people around me in that hellhole.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: You can tell much about a society from the vocabulary used by its people.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: The language used in the Backstreets is often simple and straightforward.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: They pick common words found in everyday life. They don’t bother making up special terminology.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: That applies to the things that have become a part of their everyday life. They’re often even more relevant than the original meaning of those words.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I guess the Five Fingers like the Thumb and the Index, and the Sweepers are prime examples of that.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: People in the Backstreets strive to gain wealth and power.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: They can’t afford to pursue anything more than the things to keep themselves alive.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: You know what’s funny, though?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Even if one were to have power, that power would only strike down, not up…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: The “victims” in the Backstreets were potential perpetrators who just weren’t strong enough…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Let me tell you about the story of a kid named Kali, seven years old at that time.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: The first thing the kid remembers was crying alone in the corner of an alleyway, surrounded by blood and guts.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: She didn’t have anyone to call friends. People around her would all disappear sooner or later.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Most kids her age were either abducted by the Sweepers or treated like their toys.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: The small kid couldn’t do anything but watch in silence.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: It was by sheer luck that Kali could survive until she was thirteen.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: To cherish the good fortune she was given, Kali observed and observed. In order to survive through her own effort.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: So Kali made it to twenty years of age, following strategies of her own.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: And she finally became a Fixer. There wasn’t much else she could do.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You thankfully didn’t join a Syndicate or anything, huh?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: The kid swore that she wouldn’t stoop to their level.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Kali the Fixer’s life got on a stable track some time after she started working. The work fit her well, thanks to the environment she grew up in.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh, I was the same, too.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: She thought she could now protect her neighbors living in the same apartment, given that she had some power being a Fixer.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: The streets Kali was living in were still quite dangerous.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: And she thought she ought to return the favor to Mr. Sean next door and Ms. Goose upstairs, her neighbors who she was indebted to.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Those two would often give food and drink to Kali ever since she was a child.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: They were two of the only people she’d known for a long time; they were like family to her.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Out of gratitude, she gave them some of the money she earned.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That’s nice of her.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: You know how they repaid Kali for all the money she gave them for more than a month?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I guess it wasn’t anything good, judging from the flow of your story.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: They conspired with other residents of the apartment and broke into Kali’s house while she was asleep, binding her hands and feet while looking for a safe.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh, I see what they were up to. They must’ve thought Kali was keeping much more money in her stash.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Yep. They really did try to rob her.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Kali couldn’t believe it. Not because she found herself bound when she woke up.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: It was because she saw filthy lumps of greed crawling around right before her eyes.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Just a day before, they used to be her friendly neighbors.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: They understood the agony of loss better than anyone.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Kali only hoped that the money she gave them would be used in meaningful ways…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: She just wanted to protect them with her newfound strength…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Stereotypical people, weren’t they.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’m sure Kali didn’t just let them get away with it like a fool, yeah?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: She didn’t. Kali was stronger than they thought.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: She could forcefully snap the ropes binding her at any moment, but she chose to wait.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: She wanted to believe all of this was just a misunderstanding or a prank.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: But the repulsive words they spat out so casually…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Talking about how this was their opportunity to use her money to move to a different place…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: It was neither a dream nor a misunderstanding, but a cold truth.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: So, did those sonnovabitches get what was coming to ‘em? Man, it’s upsetting just hearing this story.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: You’re right. She killed all of them. And Kali burst into tears, covered in the blood of her neighbors.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Kali’s neighbors who she had been protecting from violence were no different from the others in that they would resort to violence themselves once they had power.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: This savage cycle wouldn’t stop no matter who she tried to protect.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yeah. Sometimes, I feel like there’s no point in having any sympathy.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I also struggled a lot thinking about what’s right and wrong during my early days as a Fixer.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: What kind of Fixer were you?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …A neat and sensible Fixer who rationally handled his work, so to speak.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I held up a decent reputation.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: And then you plummeted to Grade 9 all of a sudden?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That I did. Anything can happen in life. I mean, the legendary Kali is now standing in front of me, too.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Huff… That’s true.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: To be frank, there was a time when I went batshit insane and ran amok. Didn’t care about the consequences at all.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I made a lot of enemies back then.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The sensation I felt still reverberates in my head sometimes.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: You also went through a lot, huh. I can see it in your eyes.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: I wouldn’t say I’m exactly the same being as Kali anymore, but she still rests within me.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Seems like it. You’re upright and honest, unlike most Fixers I’ve seen.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: I’ve talked too much. I’ma go get some sleep.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Sleep tight, Kali.

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library – Floor of Language

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I guess you can’t exert as much power as the Red Mist did in her prime?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Seems so. I can’t see myself to be identical to Kali, either.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What’s the big difference between the Red Mist and your present self, though?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: I used to be able to freely wield E.G.O.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: I was probably the only one in the City who could manage such a feat.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Weapons and armor that resonate with your own heart. Who could’ve imagined that?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: And now, I can’t handle those E.G.O as smoothly anymore.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: But the librarians can use E.G.O now, right?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: True. But we aren’t in full control of the E.G.O we use.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: We’re just temporarily acquiring it. From… Abnormalities.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: So, if I’m getting this right… we’re basically borrowing powers from the creatures we call Abnormalities in the form of E.G.O.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: That’s pretty much it. We’re not in the state to use them properly.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And so the Red Mist was?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Well, the sword I used to wield was extracted from someone else, but the armor was my own E.G.O.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Those empowered me greatly.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I mean, yeah, no one could’ve seen that coming.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Weapons and armor that resonate with the mind… Your foes must’ve been helpless against them.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: It’s not all that convenient. Since it literally links up with your mind, you risk getting consumed by it as well.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And the Distortion happens if you’re gobbled up by it?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: I suppose so.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Every time I used E.G.O, it felt as if someone were talking to me.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: They’re what I desperately needed to hear, but at the same time, those words are things I don’t want to listen to.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: It was like a raging torrent that could sweep my consciousness away if I ever lost my grip.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Not sure I felt that. I guess it’s because the E.G.O we use here are adjusted by Angela in advance.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: I’m mostly worried about what may happen when people out there start manifesting and using E.G.O.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Who gave you access to such amazing gear, anyway?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: …Carmen.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The person who supposedly led the research to cure humanity, wasn’t it.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Right. Carmen was from the Nest, but she wasn’t afraid to hang around the Backstreets to give her fervent speech.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: She wasn’t gonna last long if she kept that up, if we’re being honest.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: So you helped her out of pity or something?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Not a chance. I wasn’t naive enough to serve anyone without payment.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: I simply wondered just what exactly a Nest dweller would know about the agonies of the City to be so passionate about the matter.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: She brazenly went on about her absurd claim that she can break the ever-repeating cycle of suffering that goes on in the City.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: I got mad that some dweeb was spouting off like she understood everything.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: So I grabbed her and snapped at her. “How dare you rattle on about that! What do you know about the pain and suffering people in the Backstreets go through?!” I yelled.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: I thought Carmen would whimper on the verge of tears, but she instead kept a straight face and retorted with a question.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: “What do you know about the pain in the Nest, then?”

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: She said she’ll tell me all about the pain and agony of the Nest, so I should teach her about the suffering of the Backstreets in return.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: She was so shameless. I didn’t like how she acted so brash for someone so weak.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Her eyes and voice, on the other hand, carried a certain energy.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: She said even the weakest people could gain the power to easily topple the Head if they set their mind to it.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: That she will give everyone the therapy to grant such power and mindset.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: She gave me her card, telling me to come over if I was interested.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That was before you got assigned a Color, right?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Yep, I was a Grade 2 back then.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You bought into her borderline cultist hooey despite being a Grade 2?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: No, I believed her because I was that experienced, actually. I’d met countless swindlers and hacks in my life, but something about Carmen told me that she wasn’t one of them.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Just what kind of person was she…?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Anyways, I decided to count on Carmen.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: If I could protect this person, maybe this world might change.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Maybe fewer people would have to suffer the same kind of pain I did.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That’s why you worked for practically free, huh.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: All the while you did unbelievable things, becoming a living legend, and getting a Color.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Those were just extras.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Doing meaningful work was enough for me.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You sure are strong. And stupidly honest.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Heard that a lot.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Thanks for the stories, by the way.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: How about a cig?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: No thanks~ Still got loads of work to do.

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library – Floor of Language

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: The Book of the Red Mist…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: I was called that back then… Meeting my past self in person reminded me of a lot of things.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …You don’t get the opportunity to confront yourself often.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: I certainly brandished my blade trying to protect many friends and colleagues.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Even if I couldn’t meet the expectations; even if I couldn’t save them all.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yeah. That’s how the Red Mist was.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Not a lot of people can fight solely for the sake of others.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Kali the Red Mist, Gebura the Sephirah in L Corp, and my present self—a librarian…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: My three lives may not have been the same, but my spirit has carried over.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, do you find yourself miserable right now?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Not really. I do think it’s laughable, though.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: I failed to protect everyone and ended up here like this.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Still, I can say for sure that I did my best.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Don’t you have a grudge against Angela for bringing you back and forcing you in here?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And that she stole the fruit of everything you risked your life to protect, didn’t she?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: …She’s probably still wandering herself.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Thinking about everything she went through, I honestly can’t blame her so harshly for doing what she did.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: So I want to reserve my judgement until I’ve seen for myself the end of the path she’s taking.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: If I unleashed my rage at her now, nothing would change.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: It’ll only perpetuate the chain of fury and vengeance.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You didn’t even get to fully protect anything in your lives. How could you move on from that like it was nothing?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You always tried, but others would steal from you and take advantage of you…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: I’d be lying if I said I didn’t feel any anger or regret.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Even though I couldn’t protect everyone, I saved the ones I could.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’m not like you; I couldn’t even protect the one person at my side.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I don’t have anyone left.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: There’s nothing around me anymore…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: All that remains is myself, an incompetent and despicable opportunist…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’ve become a lump of obstinance before I realized it…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Nothing more than a hollow life trying to wrap itself in a glossy package…

Place.PlaceName: Location: ???

Dialog.Content: That day, my world shattered again.
Thus began the days of endlessly looking back and retracing my steps…
I was on a blind rampage. I razed anything and everything that seemed even just a little suspicious.
If you try anything stupid, I’ll make you bleed from every hole in your body. Spill it now!
I have no idea! Look, I’ll admit…
Making gear wheels out of kidnapped people was a mistake.
But, you know… I thought it’d be okay since there’s plenty of humans in the City anyhow.
So… You don’t know anything about it?
I don’t! I’m begging you, please…
I have a family. I still have a daughter to raise…
And those gears sitting back there must’ve had their own families, too.
It’s almost complete…
I’m this close to bringing back my son.
The puppets in this place were all made of children who’d already died…
So you’re saying that you’re ignorant of it.
Yes! That incident didn’t have anything to do with me.
Can’t you just let it slide…?
Please! My son is over there; he’s calling for me…
…That thing isn’t anyone’s son.

Dialog.Title: Rumanos Cartel
Dialog.Content: Shit… He’s totally lost it…

Dialog.Title: Rumanos Cartel
Dialog.Content: Are you not satisfied after what you’ve done to the Middle…
I thought I might get something out of the big shots… All they had to show was a pathetic display of brotherhood crap.
And you aren’t being much better. You seriously know nothing? I’ll happily take a lie, so get your gums flapping.

Dialog.Title: Rumanos Cartel
Dialog.Content: There is no need to play along with his aimless spite. Speak no more…

Dialog.Title: Rumanos Cartel
Dialog.Content: Just kill us. Let’s get this over with.
…As you wish.
Roland. It’s not like you to rampage like a madman. I understand how you feel, but still…
Don’t come any closer if you wanna live, Astolfo.
I’ll cut you down if you try to stop me.
Those guys don’t look like they had anything to do with the incident at all. This is plain insanity, Roland!
If only we could’ve moved into the Nest…
It’s all my fault…
You’ve killed too many… Some may have been hopeless scum, but if you relish murdering so much…
You’ll completely lose yourself!
I’m far from done. I still have a whole lot of suspects on my list.
I killed countless people.
The corpses of more people than I could ever remember piled up, forming a hill before me.
The further I tried to go into the past, the taller the hill got; and it ultimately became a mountain that blocked my sight.
Astolfo was right.
I couldn’t tell what was going on anymore.
That person was also right.
I couldn’t see ahead. This whole time, I was only looking behind.
Do I really want to find a lead to the past events and take revenge?
Or was I just looking for an outlet to gush this fury.
Is this a simple release of frustration? If I get my revenge this way, what’ll be next?
Those things no longer mattered. I didn’t have the breadth of mind to think about it.
In the end, I couldn’t protect her. It’s my fault…
It’s people’s fault… This City’s fault!!!
What will be left of the man who failed to save what he vowed to protect?
…An empty husk, that’s what remains.

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library – Floor of Language

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I don’t buy it. I bet you’re no different…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You’re just pretending to be cool-headed.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I curse this City for taking everything from me… and I loathe myself for letting it happen.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: There’s no way you can humbly be yourself in this damned world…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Roland. When raging wrath is about to engulf you, you must quench it and forge it into your weapon.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: You’ll learn to temper it soon enough.

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library – Floor of Language

Dialog.Content: Why should I begrudge it, since during the hours—
When my soul crushed the depths of my heart,
It was seated there beside me?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: How do you find this occasion, Gebura?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: I guess my past self in Lobotomy Corp. wasn’t too different from Roland just now.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Not quite. I saw you run amok in a blind fury countless times back then, and I can say that this wasn’t like those past moments.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: And it’s not quite the same as me, either.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Uh, hey, both of you… Is that supposed to be some backhanded mockery?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Not at all.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Are you feeling alright?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I feel… relieved, but something feels kinda off and awkward about it. At least my body’s all fine.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That’s good. Get back to your work once you’ve taken your time recovering from the aftermath.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: …Well, don’t mind it too much. We all have our humiliating moments.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That doesn’t make this any less awkward, man.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Roland. I well understand where your anger comes from.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
