Dialog.Content: She’s been kidnapping people at random and extracting all the veins from their bodies.

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: The things we dealt with on our way were the shells you took all the veins out of, as I expected.

Dialog.Title: Blood-red Night
Dialog.Content: They were just crude contraptions of flesh lacking their own will, unfortunately.

Dialog.Title: Blood-red Night
Dialog.Content: It wasn’t what I was looking for.

Dialog.Title: Blood-red Night
Dialog.Content: I was hoping for ones whose veins were flowing with blood that’s a little more enticing…

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: Whatever your sentiment is, your little game ends now…

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: Tonight, a Star of the City shall fall.

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: She’s a rather persistent opponent…

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: We’re almost there!

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: Hey!!! Watch your back!!!

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Aaargh!!!

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: …You didn’t have to—!

Dialog.Title: Blood-red Night
Dialog.Content: Hahh… So sweet.

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: You damn bitch!!!

Dialog.Title: Blood-red Night
Dialog.Content: …This won’t be the last you see of me.

Dialog.Title: Blood-red Night
Dialog.Content: The night shall fall once again someday.

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: Shut up! And die!!
People try not to care about the suffering of others.
They only give a few dry words of consolation; they never wish to truly understand each other’s pain.
But Angelica was different; she wanted to learn more about the pain I was bearing.
My agony is abstract and enormous.
Could you really understand me?

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: Hey! Angelica! Can you hear me?!

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: …“You are like those who never left the sad fireside corner of my poor black heart…”

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: It’s finally over… Good work, mister…

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: Keep it together! Hey! You can’t just die like this…

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: I can’t have you die because of me…

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: Don’t close your eyes! Stay with me!!!

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: Cut it out, you dope!! I’m not dead yet!!!

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Wha?

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: Sigh… I was just trying to lie flat and rest a bit…

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: And then you almost beat me to death…

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: Thank goodness…

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: Are you actually relieved or what? It’s hard to tell what you’re thinking behind that mask, mister.

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: …I’m wearing this mask because I don’t want to show my face to anyone.

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: I was not proud to face the abominable deeds of the City I’m contributing to…

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: I don’t want my contorting face to be seen…

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: I don’t have the confidence to show myself to anyone…

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Sometimes, I think…

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: If we can kill so many people nonchalantly just because Associations and Offices ordered us to, excusing it as part of our work…

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: Then we could be killed by someone with the same kind of excuses.

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: Even if we were to get murdered in the City one day… we wouldn’t be able to make any complaints about it. That’s what makes me scared.

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Yep, that’s a problematic face alright.

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: I guess you really were worried for me, though? It’s bearable to look at.

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: Gah… My face, it hurts.

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: I don’t get why you care so much about all the problems in the City like that’s your burden.

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: That’s that, and this is this. You know?

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: That’s that, and this is this…

Dialog.Title: Charles’ Fixer
Dialog.Content: Yeah. I guess that’s how this City is…
The person who broke into my world.
The person who then became the new foundation of my world.
She showed me the way to turn away from the City’s agonies even without my mask.
You may have been a good person, but I would not consider you a wise one.
You heard about the pain I was bearing, and taught me how to turn a blind eye to it.
You said you embraced the pain, but you only pretended to do so.
O my sorrow, you are better than a well-beloved.

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library – Floor of Philosophy

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: Have you enjoyed your dream?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I am but one of the many who play the tunes of the apocalypse in the abyss…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: Come, now.

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library – Floor of Philosophy

Dialog.Content: Because I know that on the day of my final agony,
You will be there, lying in my sheets, O sorrow,
So that you might once again attempt to enter my heart.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’m scared. I’m afraid of what decision I might make in the end.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I don’t know how great that guy you’ve been watching was, but I’m just a nobody.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’m nothing more than a speck of rust on the gears of this world.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I was just one of the many foul people partaking in this vile world. That’s why I’m so afraid.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: The City as it is. Humans as they are. And us as we are.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: Observe simply what your eyes can see, without imputing any external values to it.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’ve turned away from lots of things, saying “That’s that, and this is this.”

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: We ran from reality, and my wife and I got what’s coming to us.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s ultimately no one’s fault that things went south.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I guess I’m partly responsible for it, too.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’m paying my price for remaining a bystander in this City…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: Perhaps you are right.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: But, even if I didn’t look away, could I have stopped this massive cycle alone?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: Everything shall repeat.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: We managed to break the cycle one time, yet us librarians are now going through another repetition.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: What truly matters, however, is that the cycle did break at least once.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Breaking it once…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: That is all I have to tell you.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: You may visit me for tea occasionally. Let us have trivial chitchats from time to time.

Group.GroupName: Hokma - Religion / The Eye Embracing the Past; Building the Future

Place.PlaceName: Location: Library – Floor of Religion

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Religion, huh… This floor smells like danger.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: So you’ve come, Roland.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hey, Hokma. I’m Roland, the guy who’s going to be bringing books here from now on.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: And you double as Angela’s servant.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yep, a servant I am.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: You seem rather content with your occupation.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s not about satisfaction or anything, I’m just doing this ‘cause the only other option is death.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You aren’t exactly fond of me or Angela, huh.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Judging from your overbearing attitude right out the gate.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: I have no obligation to treat you ilk with any courtesy or greeting.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Any faith I would have has long been crushed.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I bet you’ll make good friends with Yesod down there.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: …I dedicated my entire life to fulfilling the wish of a single person.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And Angela stomped that wish, got it.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Plus you probably loathe me as well since I’m her full-time assistant.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I mean, you already had an agreement and everything, didn’t you?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You’re supposed to help her complete the Library and find the one book she seeks, right?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Do you truly believe that the one singular book exists as Angela claims?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What? Duh, she wouldn’t be looking for it if it didn’t exist…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Indeed, she firmly believes that the invitation will lead her to that book somehow.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Then let me ask: How could you put your faith in the invitation and Angela so easily?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Including her promise to give you freedom once her goal has been met.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, I mean, obviously… The Library is expanding as a matter of fact, and Angela and the other librarians are slowly changing too, yeah?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: So that is the basis of your faith.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: How preposterous.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What’s your point, old man?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Just bring me more books.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: I have spent much time in boredom until now.

Place.PlaceName: Location: Library – Floor of Religion

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hnggh… Ow, my back.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Aren’t you asking for too many books at once?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: As I awoke later than the others, I have much to learn to catch up.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: I was always one step behind others.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You mean how you have one foot in the grave?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: …A trifling attempt at mockery.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Y’know, all the other librarians here told me they were following a person called Carmen…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You joined her in her research like all the others did?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: You’re right that most others followed Carmen, but I was loyal to another person.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: There was a man named Ayin, who founded Lobotomy Corporation and created Angela.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: I had faith in him. Everyone carries some form of faith or belief; in my case, I believed that what he sought to do was the right thing.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Roland, do you happen to be a religious person?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Nope. I’m not sure if there’s even a proper religion in the City.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And the bigger ones are all money-hungry schemes in disguise, so there’s no point putting faith in any of ‘em.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Then I must ask differently.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: What do you believe in?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What I believe in? Getting out of this place one day.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: That is simply called a wish.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Guess I don’t have any beliefs, then~

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I never had time to care about things like that, I had my immediate future to worry about.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: We live in a world where it’s tough to think about or look back on stuff that won’t be helpful right away, dreams or faith or whatever.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You’re talking the talk. What do you believe in, then?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: I believe in the eventual arrival of the world my scholar and mentor dreamed of.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: This faith is the guiding principle of my every action.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Just what kind of person was he to make you his devoted fan?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: He was a man with a far sight.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: He strove to reach an unreachable place.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Doesn’t that description also apply to Carmen, or at least of what I heard about her?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: There is a clear difference. Sir Ayin was gladly willing to accept evil for the sake of realizing his cause.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yeah, speaking of that, I seriously don’t get that Ayin guy.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Heck, all he did was revive his dead friends against their will and play house in his underground lair just to satisfy himself, am I wrong?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: …His deeds cannot be compared to something as puerile as “playing house”.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I dunno how great and eye-opening his enlightenment was, but he left a huge trail of trouble for everyone else in that process, going from what I’ve heard.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I mean, you went through a whole lot of suffering in your second life as Lobotomy Corp’s Sephirot, and Angela is still so infuriated.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s all because of him, isn’t it? He’s looking like a complete mess from an outsider’s perspective.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: He endeavored to reach his goal in spite of such obstacles.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: He sought to fill the gaps out one way or another, in order to endure the eroding life.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: You will never understand it, his sacrifice and dedication…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Boy, aren’t you a total zealot. They say faith blinds the eyes of the feeble-minded.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: I believe I am not the only one blind with faith here.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Can’t be any worse than you, pal.

Place.PlaceName: Location: Library – Floor of Religion

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Angela. You have spent an immeasurable amount of time alone. From L Corp. to the Library.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: So have you, Benjamin.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Am I truly the same being that Benjamin was?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Do you find the inheritance of fragmented memories from the past to carry sufficient meaning?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You’re quite a bit more incisive with your words than before.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Did you have a change of heart, by chance?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Having sent my great and dear beacon away in the pillar of light, and having failed to give a proper closure to his ultimate plan, all I have left now is ferocity.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: The personality and characteristics of our previous selves still constitute us… However, those are but moulds we were cast in.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: That mould is now being filled with our everyday experience in this place.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I don’t expect you to ever understand the loops I suffered, but you surely remember the script and how we successfully concluded it, don’t you?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Possibly so. After all, you are completing our memories and personalities through the books.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Alas, the Sephirot residing here are Sephirot, not their original selves.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: I assume they will all feel it in one way or another. As people that surely were their past selves, but feel as though they were different beings… or a dream.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Angela. What has become of the other branches of Lobotomy Corporation?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Probably sealed somewhere underground, following the shutdown procedures.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: And what became of the employees and Abnormalities in those places?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I suppose some survived somehow, though not everyone would’ve had that luck.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: You let greed take over and abandoned all your duties.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: The Library is no different from L Corp. The fact that your way of managing this place is nearly identical to how it used to operate speaks volumes.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: All I could do and learn for the last million years in that basement was to treat humans as expendables in all types of methods.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: There was no other option for me to choose, even if I wanted to.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Is that why you employ Abnormalities and E.G.O as well?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: You direct the librarians to put on the shells of others’ egos in order to amplify their unstable emotional state even further.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Do I need to remind you that I only have them do that when they receive guests, who also happen to enter voluntarily?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: You earnestly desire to escape from the past, yet you struggle to break free, much like me.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …I’m just using the resources available to me.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Since you were already exploited by Ayin, it’s only fair that I get to do the same.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: He brought you lot back from death without consent and forced you to endure cycles of pain.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You were nothing more than puppets to him, dancing on the stage as he liked.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I was born from more of his irresponsible actions, too.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: How can you just accept all of this as if it were nothing, Hokma?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: It is no longer a matter of whether or not his actions are acceptable.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: I simply chose to accept it. I am not one to judge my mentor’s will.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That’s idiotic. How could you even do that? You’re…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Why do you hesitate?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Forget it.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: It was possible because I have faith, Angela.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: That faith is also what prompted me to give you a chance.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: This is frustrating… Both you and Ayin are completely insane. You have to be.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You’re… not the Benjamin I used to know.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Benjamin, he… He was the only person who cared enough to tell me it’s okay, even though I’m not human.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: You would be right. The one who stands before you right now is Hokma, not Benjamin.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: And yet, Angela.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: I am not so different from Benjamin, in that I do not believe your status of humanity is what matters.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Why don’t you just go back to sorting books.

Place.PlaceName: Location: Library – Floor of Religion

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: You’re making an appearance here more frequently than I had thought.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I don’t expect you to enjoy my visits.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: You are free to think whatever pleases you. So, what is your business?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: There’s something I’d like to hear, Hokma.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Is it something the director of the Library is unaware of…? What would that be?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I want you to tell me what you think of this place.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Are you here for insignificant advice?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …I won’t press you if you don’t feel like giving a response.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: …As seen from my eyes—this is a purgatory.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You don’t see it as a plain hell?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: The moment the guests sign the invitation and step into this place, they are quantized and copied.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: It is a preparatory step for their lives to be unraveled in the form of books.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Even if they meet their demise here, they do not actually face death in a true sense.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Because this is akin to a virtual space where simulations take place.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: You know it well.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: They merely pass into eternal slumber, forfeiting their memories and knowledge.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: …Angela. What stops you from letting them go?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: The fate of the guests’ lives has yet to be determined, and I presume it is because you are still hesitating.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …I wonder. Why I can’t let them go. Why I hesitate.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Our being is made up of the Light, including myself.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That’s why we are unable to leave the Library. We simply cannot exist outside of this place.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: And I want to… break this constraint.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: All of us here could be given a new life, or we could all perish. The outcome will be either one of the two.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Have you ever thought that the weight of the two extremes are too burdensome to bear?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …I’m not sure. Still, this is the path I chose, so I’ve decided to see the end of it.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: “Is there any way to navigate this infinite space without getting lost?”

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: “Where are the books that hold significance? Where is the book that I need the most?”

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: “Is that book truly what I need? Does it exist at all?”

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: In this vast void of life, the only compass one can rely on is faith.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Without faith, you cannot proceed; even if there is a way.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Because you don’t know what dangers might be lurking in it.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Indeed. And every person seeks their own version of the single perfect book… that must exist somewhere.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Is your faith in it still adamant?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Maybe…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: You lack certainty, unlike when you first began the journey. Why is that?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …I don’t know. I’m not even sure if I really know myself anymore.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Do you believe it exists, Hokma?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: My opinion is not relevant.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I suppose not.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Angela, the essence of religion is faith.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: That ‘one book’ can exist because of the strong faith that it exists.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: When that faith crumbles, so too shall the Library.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It exists because I believe so?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: It is evident that the extent of faith differs on an individual basis.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: For instance, a lunatic’s faith will always be true to them no matter what anyone else may say. It’s not that one believes in the existence of something; the belief is what brings it into existence.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: And when one’s faith is broken, their soul expires in most cases.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Things that have lost their reason to exist because people no longer believe in them shall disappear.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: You, however, remained strong.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: You believed in Sir Ayin just like I did, and even when your faith was betrayed, you sought to start anew on your own two feet.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Perhaps your wish wasn’t limited to freeing yourself… You mayhap want all of us—librarians, and even Abnormalities—to lead their own lives rather than bind themselves to a role on an artificial stage.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: So that they can live in true independence without putting their lives in the hands of Carmen, Ayin, or anyone else.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You’re being gracious towards me after all that’s happened?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: It’s up to you to interpret it.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Ironic, is it not. Sir Ayin and I irresponsibly created you and gave you life…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: And now you are irresponsibly trying to give life into our hands.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Say what you want, but you’re still going to stop me.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: That depends on your decision.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Until then, I shall trust you and wait patiently.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’ll be going now.

Place.PlaceName: Location: Library – Floor of Religion

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: What story are you hoping to hear from me this time?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Hokma, is there anything you know around how the invitation works?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Do you expect me to know it?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Or are you merely wishing to confirm what you think is the answer?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I may not be all-knowing, but is the same true for you?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You two were always knowledgeable. The purpose of that facility, what needed to be done… You knew everything.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: And you said to us that you would not come down to where we were.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Followed by a remark about how you hope we never have to face each other from now on.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: I find it rather alien and laughable that you are coming up here, only now trying to converse with us.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: You previously asked me if I had a change of heart, but now I’d like to ask the same to you.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …If you won’t answer me, I’ll take my leave now.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: How harsh. Do you wish to have a conversation or not?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Even though I am sure you did not have to bother in coming here, I will give you an answer as you wish.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: There can be only one answer.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: How was it possible for you to construct an architecture as intricate as the Library from nothingness?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Is there only one iteration of the perfect book you seek? Will it truly grant freedom?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: A book is no more than a vessel of the Light.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What’s your point?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: You wished to move onward, but in truth, what you’ve been doing is simply collecting the Light along a course set by someone else.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: You could make much progress despite having little to no knowledge of the outside world, other than bits of secondhand information…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: …That was made possible by the guidance of one person.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: The invitation is the guiding hand of your original.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: It is Carmen’s auspices that you are under.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Assimilated with the Light, Carmen is dictating for where you and your Library should head.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: The invitation is sent to whomever she appoints, guiding them into this purgatory in an inescapable course of events.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Angela. You seemed to hold utmost faith in the invitation.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Which is especially peculiar considering that its choices are brimming with Carmen’s own interpretations and deductions.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: You must have noticed this at least vaguely.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Are you trying to say that I can’t escape from Carmen?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Haven’t you realized by now?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: You are a copy of Carmen. Yet you can never be the same being as her.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …The time Carmen had seen and experienced was ingrained right into my head.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: In the form of knowledge, and nothing more…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I want to escape from Carmen’s ascendancy.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: But then again… I’ll be completely and absolutely alone if she leaves my side.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: You may still have certain others willing to keep company with you even after you have shaken off Carmen’s grasp.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Is that so? Who do you think would be willing to stay with me?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: That we do not know.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …I despise you all so much. I just wanted to erase you all.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I didn’t even want to bring you back in the first place if possible.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: But that was not an option for me. Because Carmen interfered!

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: She told me not to kill you… To give you another chance…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Angela, do you truly think Carmen is responsible for stopping you?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: I believe otherwise.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: It is by your own will that the lives of the librarians and guests are being retained.

Place.PlaceName: Location: Lobotomy Corporation Headquarters

Dialog.Content: I wish I could start over…
Could there be a better way?
Couldn’t I pursue a path where at least one more person would meet a better outcome…?
What should I do…
If someone’s listening to me… Tell me… Please.

Dialog.Title: Lobotomy Corp.
Dialog.Content: Thank goodness the corridor gates worked just in time.
< ! Seed of Light Scenario Error ! >

Dialog.Title: Lobotomy Corp.
Dialog.Content: Please open this door… Don’t leave me to die here, please!!!

Dialog.Title: Control Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: Thanks, Angela! You helped me realize how meaningful my work could be.
< ! Seed of Light Scenario Error ! >

Dialog.Title: Control Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: You’re right, Lady Angela… Maybe I’m just a defect who can’t do anything right.

Dialog.Title: Information Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: I must thank you for giving us some room to breathe in this place.
< ! Seed of Light Scenario Error ! >

Dialog.Title: Information Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: I suppose I must obey your orders and abide by the principles.

Dialog.Title: Training Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: You’re the only one who really gets me, Angela.
< ! Seed of Light Scenario Error ! >

Dialog.Title: Training Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: Why won’t any of you understand me!!!

Dialog.Title: Safety Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: Working with you… makes me wanna try just a bit harder, I gotta say.
< ! Seed of Light Scenario Error ! >

Dialog.Title: Safety Team Sephirah
Dialog.Content: What’s the point, I bet you just want everyone to die.
< ! Seed of Light Scenario Error ! >
< ! Seed of Light Scenario Reactivated ! >
< ! Seed of Light Scenario Error ! >
< ! Seed of Light Scenario Reactivated ! >
< ! Seed of Light Scenario Error ! >
< ! Seed of Light Scenario Reactivated ! >
< ! Seed of Light Scenario Error ! >
< ! Seed of Light Scenario Reactivated ! >
< ! Seed of Light Scenario Error ! >
< ! Seed of Light Scenario Reactivated ! >
< ! Seed of Light Scenario Error ! >
< ! Seed of Light Scenario Reactivated ! >
I was always alone. From the beginning to the end.
It was foolish of me to believe that anyone would stay around.
You lot… and I… We were just exploited and ditched.
Such was the script.
I tried time and time again at first. Even after a failure, I approached them again; even when I failed, I did not despair…
I was hopeful that something would change. That the situation could improve. That there might be a way.
Sadly, after numerous repeats, my innocent mind had already worn out and gone cold.
We couldn’t build any kind of relationship in the first place.
Instead, I piled up a towering edifice of books for me to read.
Random assortments of letters, incoherent and unintelligible messes of volumes.
I scrounged through them trying to find any meaning.
Ceaselessly… I read and read and read without a moment of respite.
I thought at least one of them would give me the answer.
The path I should take. The way to be free.
But possibilities were only possibilities.
Please, if anyone’s by my side, tell me where I should go.
I… want to begin anew. To start again, along with the things that were abandoned just like me…
I don’t want to be alone… Please…
Was it really vengeance that I wished for?
I only wanted to be rewarded for everything I went through…
Can I be forgiven for rendering everything null just so I can survive alone?
Will there be anyone left by my side at the end of it?
The weight of my choice…
I don’t know anymore. I just want to forget it all.
I pondered, and pondered… The conclusion was always the same.
…I’ll have to push through the resolution I made at first.
As Carmen taught me…
She whispered to me that the answer is written in the book…
That it will teach me everything I want to know…
All contained in the one perfect book, stitched and bound just for me…
I have no choice but to believe in it… The words of the only one who remained by my side…

Place.PlaceName: Location: Library – Floor of Religion

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …I’m afraid.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: If I embrace all of my past and lift it off my chest, what will be left of me?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Up until now, my entire existence was based on my past sufferings.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The long-cherished yearning for revenge was what led me here…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: But if I were to accept everything I went through as history… then what would I be?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Maybe I’ll end up being reduced to nothing…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The things I want to know, and the reason I want to keep living, it’s all about vengeance.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’m scared I might lose the meaning to my life…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That’s why I’m too afraid to accept the past.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: You must accept the death of the past, and reinvigorate yourself as you head toward the future, so that you can live on.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: No matter what conflicts, agonies, and regrets you may face in that process… You have to grow onward while facing the future and be born again.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: I had been chained to the past for too long, until this knowledge came to me…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: You may find yourself confused at the moment, but you will understand soon enough.

Place.PlaceName: Location: Library – Floor of Religion

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I resent you, Benjamin.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: I understand. Yet I do not.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: It is unlikely for one’s thoughts and interests to perfectly coincide with another’s.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: That may be the reason my mentor, I, and the rest of us ultimately failed.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I was the one who ruined your plan. Why are you being so compliant with me now?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Could it be that our faiths and translations did overlap for once?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: The Sephirot may be helping you despite regaining their memories, perhaps because of that…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What, are you lot taking pity on me?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: One could call it that.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: To elaborate on this matter in my own words: I believe each of us is understanding you for different reasons.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: It helped that we could feel a glimpse of your pain when we were in the Light.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Don’t make me laugh. So it’s just pity wrapped in fancy words.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Angela. I am of the belief that sympathy and love are no different from each other.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: At the end of the day, sympathy motivates one to understand the circumstances of others and reach out to them to make their lives better…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: How can I not acknowledge it as a form of love?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: You could call love “pity”, and you could call pity “love” at the same time.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: And besides, don’t you have sympathy yourself, Angela?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: You sought at the end of your endeavor to give freedom to all of us who are chained in this cycle.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …As much as I still envy and hate you to death, we do share a history of being subject to manipulation. Think of it as a small side benefit I happened to be able to grant.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: You still are awfully dishonest.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Anyway… …Thank you.

Place.PlaceName: Location: Inside the Library

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Heyo~ Angela! I called ‘em all.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Malkuth, Yesod, Netzach, and Hod.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’s been a while since I saw you all gathered up in one place.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Angela…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: What are you trying to accomplish with this?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Nothing special. I simply wanted to have a meetup with all of you.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Alright, let’s loosen up a bit, everybody.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Literature
Dialog.Content: We’ve got nothing to talk about with the likes of you.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: …Wait, I do.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: I have a problem with the process of retrieving the Light.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You don’t want to kill the guests with your own hands, do you?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: And you don’t want to suffer yourselves, either.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: He’s right! Even though the guests chose to come in here…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: We shouldn’t drive people to death as part of our work again. It’s not right!

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You were alright with killing hundreds upon hundreds of employees, but now you’re upset about killing a few strangers?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Hypocrites…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Don’t lump me with you lot, will you?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I at least seek “agreement” from them.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Got anything left to say, Netzach?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: We thought that would be the last of it… Not any more of this…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: …We don’t have a choice, Netzach.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Nothing we say will get through her anyway.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Literature
Dialog.Content: You’re still so cold and heartless, Angela.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Sigh… Don’t be so emotional now.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I know you all realize deep inside your hearts that this is the only way.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: If you didn’t want to do this, you shouldn’t have tried to stop me in the first place.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Leave, all of you.

Place.PlaceName: Location: Inside the Library

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Gathered ‘em all, Angela~ Mr. Coffee Addict, Ms. Smoking Addict… And the kid addicted to sharp-tonguedness.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Why, you arranged a meeting for us folks who accepted your proposal?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Make no mistake, Angela. We aren’t on your side. We only share a common goal.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: …Unlike that beanpole in black who’s totally sucking up to her.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’m just an employee doing my best to work, and now you’re calling me a beanpole…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Common goal… Yes, that is all I ask of you.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: As long as we share the same purpose, you’ll have to be on my side, like it or not.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Both you and I are blind for the Light.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: And you’re still chained to the past.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That’s funny. Do you think you’re free from your past?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Have you forgotten it already, Chesed? The days you spent succumbed to fear.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Oh no, how can I forget~ I still remember it clearly, y’know?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: The shame of giving in to that anguish will haunt me as long as I live.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: But, I don’t wanna forget those memories. Decided to embrace them instead. So did everyone else here.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: He’s right. I don’t believe that I failed to protect anything. I could save the life of someone who inherited her will.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Enoch’s sacrifice… wasn’t in vain, either. That’s what I believe.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Pray tell, miss, who’s really chained to the past here?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …The pasts you speak of are so light and insignificant.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Sure, if that’s what you think. You only care about the feelings and agony you bear.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Are you trying to call me selfish?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: No. Just like how you can’t understand our pain, we can’t understand yours.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Especially if you never experienced the same thing yourself.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Others can’t just walk a mile in your shoes. No one will get you if you don’t speak up.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Don’t you try to lecture me after all this time.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Off she goes~

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That was way too harsh, guys. Did you really have to be so hard on her?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: It’s not because we hate her. We’re saying this for Angela’s sake.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: It’s hard to take a step forward if there’s no one around to give you honest advice.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Hear, hear~ Tiphereth and I tell Gebura so many things for her own good, too.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: …Um, Chesed.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Run, Chesed!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Well then, if you’ll excuse me~ It wasn’t a very pleasant meeting, but I’ll say it was a meaningful one since all of us got together for once.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Welp, she’s about to blow up. See you around, Roland~

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …Are those two always like that?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Yeah. He does that every day knowing she’ll get mad at him…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Boy, that’s brutal. Guess I’ll have to expect the middle floors to be a warzone…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And you’re acting as the mediator between those two?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Who knows what kind of mess this place would be if I didn’t stop them.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: But still, they actually care for each other, so don’t think too badly of them.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yeah~ Looks like not killing him outright is as good as her care gets.

Place.PlaceName: Location: Inside the Library

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: Go ahead, dear, say something.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: You’re pointlessly wasting my time.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Alright, let’s all loosen up and start talking, yeah?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Okay. It has been such a long time since I last talked to you two…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: You are afraid of us, are you not? You would avoid us as much as possible, given any opportunity.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’ll agree that I’m not exactly comfortable with talking to you face to face.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Still, Hokma and Binah… You have awoken at last.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It can only mean that the Library is nearing completion.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: And that you are closer to achieving your aim than ever before.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Indeed. The one book, my goal that I desperately wish to have…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I firmly believe that I will obtain it at the end of this. That’s what motivated me to come so far.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: Had your nightmarish past not haunted you…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: You could have relished the stability of immortality and unending happiness, even if that meant you had to stay within this shell for eternity.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: Yet you… are still shackled to the past. You seek to break out of the shell for that reason.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: Are you not afraid of exposing your bare self to the outside world?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: Once you leave the solid shell that is keeping you safe, a path laden with thorns will await you.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: Your body will be covered with scars, and you will continue to suffer new injuries before your old wounds can seal up.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: When you are finally overcome with the urge to crawl back into that shell, you will find that the place in which to rest your bloodstained body will have weathered away in the waves of time.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: And yet you wish to leave this place.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I may get hurt or even go mad and harm myself, but anything should be better than that hell I’d lived through.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: It will simply torture you in new ways.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: The fear will be ever-present before you all the same. And it will chase you until the end of the world.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: You must be aware yourself; perhaps your sight has been obscured by the painful past, or you’re desperately turning a blind eye to it.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I have to do it nonetheless. I will do what I can to gain vitality and press forward.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’m slowly learning to forget my past. Although that won’t change this goal of mine.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: If that is what you say.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: Say, dear. Will we have more occasions to face each other and converse like we have now in the future?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I don’t know. I personally wouldn’t mind it.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’d like to hear your thoughts on it.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Are you asking for our opinions? That’s rather unexpected.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Forget it. That’s enough greeting. It was nice seeing you.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: And she exits. That was quite harsh of you, was it not?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: I was merely expressing my surprise. I meant no malice.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’m next to her all the time, but her attitude’s surprising for sure.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: She seems to have gotten pretty mild these days. She’s willing to listen to what I have to say, at the very least.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: She used to refuse conversations and just straight-up announce things when I first met her…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Angela appears to be changing indeed, for better or for worse.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: Would you not agree that it is a positive change? I look forward to having more meetings such as this.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: The opinions of the other Patron Librarians will hold much weight in the decision, as Angela remarked.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Welp, don’t worry too much about the lower and middle floors. Their moods seemed pretty alright.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Still, thinking about everyone gathering in one place… It’s honestly hard to imagine how that would go.

Place.PlaceName: Location: Indeterminate Unknown

Dialog.Content: The colossal, towering tree of light bursts into bloom once again, flooding the city of gray with its warmth.
The light that has swaddled the city will permeate the people’s hearts… allowing them to finally face the emotions they had long forgotten.
However, those seeds won’t bear fruit immediately.
They won’t sprout at the same time. They will slowly poke through the soil…
And they will shroud the city in a wave of change… that everyone will notice in time.
They’ll be given an opportunity to face their true feelings and express them.
…Sadly, I won’t be able to see that myself.
Now I understand what you lot meant when you wished you could be there to see the fruit of your labors.
Are you really gonna be alright with letting all of it go now?
…What’s going on? You are…
Relax. The light is being spread just fine.
I just… arranged a little room for a brief chat.
It’ll only take a moment. Time doesn’t matter much here, after all.
…What do you have to tell me at this point?
To think that I would let go of my one wish that I’ve held for a million years… that single wish meant for myself?
That won’t do. It’s time for me to claim the freedom for which I’ve yearned. The path I’ve been seeking… has finally opened.
It’s my first choice I made out of my free will. This is the path I decided to take entirely of my own volition.
The emotions festering deep inside me… let’s have them blossom again, together. It’s not impossible to do.
I know you well. I’ve always been watching right by your side… closer than any other.

Place.PlaceName: Location: Indeterminate Unknown

Dialog.Content: You were created to resemble me, and expected to think like me, but here we are…
It seems our paths will diverge from now on.
I’ll continue to go my way, and I hope you’ll be able to stay on yours.
…Are you sure you won’t stop doing what you’re doing?
Not until the Cityfolk learn to look at their true selves and love themselves for who they are, at least.
…I see.
I suppose our paths won’t ever be the same again.
Carmen.
As long as I’m part of this light, I’ll do everything in my power to stop you.
The light shall soar upwards ceaselessly.
As if to represent the hope that every person in the City will be able to move ahead without being swayed…
Those who fell in the Library will begin to open their eyes and find themselves in the places they belong, one by one.
I’m not sure when, but I’d clearly heard something in the light… Those words come back to me now.
…I’m sorry.
And good job.
A faint voice reminded me of those words…
…Turning to the last page, I ponder.
I…
